Reviews.Author: TerryBKK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night in May 2010 and find the hotel to be ok. I must attribute this to my overly high expectation before arriving. I heard and read a lot about Fullerton Hotel Singapore. The room I got is Courtyard room and excluding the view, the room ambience, bed, design and etc is slightly out of date. The only thing I like is the gym. Location should not be matter as Singapore is well known for its 1st class public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Good conference facilities”
Reviews.Author: Balaji V
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fullerton for an investor’s conference for some of our key clients for 2-3 days and we had a good experience. The service is friendly and our relationship manager for the conference did a great job – ever accommodative. The hotel facilities for the conference were also nice and considering that we had around 40 rooms blocked with meetings going on simultaneously in at least 20-25 rooms followed by a gala dinner in one of their spacious banquet halls in the evening, the entire event went off smoothly. Food was good and the rooms spacious. The hotel is located on the boat quay with a beautiful view of the riverside and a number of restaurant and eateries dotting the bay. Lots of options for sea-food lovers. A great place for a walk or satisfying some hunger pangs. The Fullerton can also be considered for personal stay apart from business.

Reviews.Title: “No hotel in Singapore would be better than "The Fullerton Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: diveshkhr
Reviews.Content: I like the hotel and amazed by the service provided and room had a incredible view. I found out that there was hardly anything to complain. The staffs were patient and attended to all my needs & requests. I like their professionalism. Also, the GM was friendly. My stay here was well worth and as a frequent traveler to Singapore, I definitely will choose this hotel for my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “In a class of its own: Majestic.”
Reviews.Author: HFShah
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night for a business trip. Recommended by my Singaporean business partner, I had no doubt that Fullerton would be a good choice as it is just a walking distant to the venue of our event, Empress Place, but it was quite pricey, so I had to justify to my boss that choosing another hotel within that same financial district would cost just as much, hence I might as well settle for Fullerton. When I arrived at the main entrance, the sight of fleet of vintage and luxurious sports cars at the valet area indicates that it is well received by the upper class. Being one of Sinagpore's most famous landmark Fullerton does not simply rely on its architectural grandeur and heritage as Singapore's previous General Post Office to attract people to stay. The service was equally excellent from the beautiful receptionist to the friendly bell boy. The lobby has a huge pool with koi fishes swimming freely in it. My room (Courtyard) had all the amenities that any 5-star would give. Too bad I spent only 5 hours sleeping on the super comfy bed (back from function at 2am and had to check out by 7am). One thing I dislike about the hotel is that the building was actually hollow in the middle (like a box-shaped stadium with roof), hence when I took the lift at one end, I had to take a LONG walk to my room (approximately 2 minute from the lift). The breakfast spread was not as extensive as other 5-star hotels that I have been, but the taste and quality of the food were just yummy! Had my breakfast al fresco next to the river near Boat Quay with a fantastic morning view of Singaporean skyscrapers (now I know why the hotel is so expensive!). Overall, had a good stay. Don't mind coming back (as long as my company's paying!)

Reviews.Title: “Six star hotel with seven star service, will definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Peterjules
Reviews.Content: What can I say about a perfect stay? We managed to get a great Suite deal directly with the hotel and when checking in, we were upgraded to a larger suite as we were staying for 5 nights. The suite was terrific - very roomy and very comfortable. The Straits club access was worth the small amount extra as we had access to champagne breakfasts, afternoon teas as well as cocktail evenings. The hotel itself has a very elegant and luxurious feel to it. To compliment this, the staff here could not do enough for us. They were incredible and extremely friendly and very polite. We have stayed in many 5 star hotels around the world, but the service we received here was possibly the best. The Hotel is in a great location for MRT which is handy to access most of the tourist attractions in Singapore. Also, close at hand are walks around the Marina and for dinner at Clarke Quay. However, if you don't feel like travelling too far, there are certainly many choices regarding eating in the hotel. Chinatown was only a short journey as well, and we loved the bargain shopping here. Very sad to leave this magnificent hotel with the terrific staff, but to sum it up, we would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Super stay, wonderful getaway!”
Reviews.Author: BibiJans
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fullerton at the start of our holiday and we absolutely loved it. Flying in to Singapore very early in the morning, we arrived at the hotel reception at 7 a.m. The kind lady at the reception invited us to use the spa until our room was ready. At about 10.45 our room was made available to us, we really appreciated this gracious service! Our stay at the Fullerton was a very stylish and memorable start of our holiday. Our courtyard room was very comfortable – and near the lovely pool area (which we used a number of times). The staff were very kind, helpful and professional. And we loved the al fresco breakfast! The evening buffet is also something to indulge in...we really felt pampered and will gladly return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Would go back again in a heart beat!”
Reviews.Author: EvaPerth
Reviews.Content: We only stayed a night but the service was great. And the room (Courtyard) was excellent. Simple but elegant! Would love to stay there again - just beautiful! I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location! Wonderful facilities!”
Reviews.Author: boop31
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our room which was overlooking the river. Very clean. Bathroom was also very clean. Had a separate tub and shower area. Perfect base for walking around to the Esplanade, Boat Quay, Museums, Lau Pa Sat Festival Market, etc. Merlion is right in front of the hotel. One Fullerton accessible via underground travellator. Safe pleasant area to walk around even at night. Walk 5-7 minutes to the subway station so you can reach Orchard Rd for shopping. The hop on, hop off tour bus stops at the Fullerton. Town Restaurant had super yummy Singaporean Chili Crab! Pricey hotel but worth it! Just get the rooms with a view

Reviews.Title: “QUALITY EVERY TIME”
Reviews.Author: huxtable
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here on 5 occasions now. We have returned back yearly for a while now. We love Singapore and love the Fullerton. The service from front desk to the rooms to the breakfast is always fantastic and friendly. Break fast is always great by the boat quay. The only issue is distance from the business district. But, it is good too walk anyway, to burn off some of the calories we indulge in whilst there. You should try the Indian curry buffet. you should have swim in the pool with its magnificent view. You should try and get a room with Quay view. You should avoid eating on Boat quay, this is a rip off and tourist trap. Walk to Glutton's corner instead by the water for a great selection of local delights at much lower prices. I can summarize this hotel best by saying that every time we stay somewhere else and walk past the Fullerton, we regret not having stayed there. This from couple that have travelled to Singapore on 14 occasions in 9 years !.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, fantastic breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Hedgeman63
Reviews.Content: Deserves its 5 Star rating, good sized rooms, no noise, not as outstanding as some other Asian 5 stars, but very good. And an amazing buffet breakfast, well worth a visit even if you do not stay in the hotel, nice live music in the lobby and location next to business districtand boatquay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel! Bit Expensive though...”
Reviews.Author: AliT123
Reviews.Content: This is a world class hotel and comes highly recommended. This has to be one of the top hotels in Singapore. Great views from the rooms, good location, fantasic atmosphere and world class service. I stayed here for 10 days, ran up a massive bill, but still didn't want to leave at the end of it...

Reviews.Title: “Sheer Opulence”
Reviews.Author: SueTilley
Reviews.Content: Have visited Singapore several times before but have only ever stayed with relatives, so to stay at the Fullerton was a real treat, which more than lived up to my expectations. It goes beyond luxury and nothing is too much trouble. Forget the multi national chains and just stay here! No comparison to that other well known hotel, which is little more than a tourist centre now. Just wish I could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we stayed here”
Reviews.Author: Firenze1
Reviews.Content: Booked a cheapish deal through Travel republic for a courtyard room inc breakfast, bit apprehensive after some reviews of these rooms , ok , no view which would have been icing on cake , but hey who sits in their room, and it was very comfortable with a lovely bathroom and the hotel facilities are fantastic. Lovely buffet breakfast with huge choice taken sitting on terrace by the river. Great pool with stunning views of the river, plenty of fluffy white towels and a good poolside menu. The staff were all extremely friendly and very professional we really enjoyed returning from the heat of the city to this oasis of civilised tranquility. Only small gripe was the hotel concierge told us a taxi to the airport would be no more than $18-20 but was in fact about $35 after the hotel doorman put us in a premier taxi which we didnt realise until we came to pay the driver, so that was anonoying. But I wouldnt hesitate to stay here again. Go enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Pure dead Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: fibiScotland
Reviews.Content: We treated ourselves to a suite in the Fullerton. It was spacious, comfortable and very plush but a bit strange as there were no windows to see out of- however we realise that it preserving the old building and there was plently of light from very high windows- it was juts a shame not to be able to see out. That is the only negative everything else was just wonderful from the breakfast spread to the infinity pool to the staff to the bathroom- all of it every aspect was just divine!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: kenneth1613
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from 2nd to 5th March and we really enjoyed our stay at the Fullerton hotel. We got a quay room facing the Marina Bay with fantastic views of the Singapore Flyer, Esplanade and its surroundings. The room came with free tickets to the Flyer, river cruise to Clark Quay, Asian Civilisation and Peranakan Museum entrances. We visited the hotel's Asian Spa and we took their "Pure Romance Roses" couple spa package and the experience was great. We dined at The Lighthouse restaurant located at the hotel"s top floor that gave a sweeping view of the bay area. The Jade restaurant serves delicious chinese food. Overall, the experience with Fullerton hotel was truly amazing, not forgetting the great services provided by all the staff from the front desk to the concierge to even the housekeeping department. This hotel truly did Singapore proud. Keep it up!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Building, large room, great view...”
Reviews.Author: LittleLadyTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights at the beginning of our honeymoon and it was lovely. This coverted post office building is beautiful outside and has had an amazing refurbishment on the inside. The entrance hall is huge and really stunning to walk into after a long journey. The staff we're very friendly from the reception staff, cleaning staff, door staff and the porters were all very helpful and friendly. The pool was very clean, plenty of towels to help yourself to, we ordered food and drinks to the pool and charged them to our room and the price was quite reasonable for a 5star hotel. It's in a great location to travel around the city, there's plenty to do in Singapore and you could easily stay for longer and just cover most attractions. There's a restaurant opposite its huge and lite up at night the food was fabulous at this place it's a must if you eat there definitley do, it was the same price as the chinese we ate at the night before and ten times better in taste, service and experience. The night Safari was brilliant, allow yourself several hours to watch the animal shows which are great and not at all mean or harmful to the animals. Also if you can do some of the walking trails they are excellent too you see some amazing creatures, if your short for time hop on the train that takes you around. Sentosa Island is great to, again lots of beaches, amusments, water world, butterfly park the list goes on.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but slightly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: StarQueen79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend as a Valentine's treat, having booked their special Valentine's package on the internet which included a Quay room, a complimentary bottle of wine, bath treats and bath robes, and a 4-course in-room dining experience for $500. The hotel is beautiful and a real icon in Singapore, so I was very excited to be staying here, even though I have eaten at several of the hotel's restaurants before. Our Quay room on the 7th floor came with a balcony that had fabulous views across the Marina, but it was surprisingly small. (This became even more apparent during our in-room meal where the waiter struggled to get the dining trolley between the bed and the tv cabinet!) Having just settled into our room we received a call asking us what time we would like to dine and what our meal choices were. This was a bit annoying as we had been asked to pre-choose these when we booked, so we were surprised they didn't seem to have the information. We went down to Post Bar in the lobby for some pre-dinner drinks. The cocktail list is very extensive and the bar tenders know what they are doing - we enjoyed some fabulous concotions! Whilst we were sipping away, the fire alarm sounded on several occasions although at no point did anyone come and speak to us about evacuating or there being a problem (friends who were also staying at the hotel kept being evacuated from their room). We went to head upstairs about 7.45 pm for our meal at 8pm, but were told the lifts could not be used because of the fire bell. We asked the kitchen to be notified and our meal delayed until we could access our room. Within 5 minutes we were were able to go back up, although no-one explained what the problem had been. Perhaps because of the fire alarm problem, our meal arrived late at 8.15 pm, and sadly came without our twice pre-ordered bottle of white wine which we had to chase up when we were on the second course. When it did arrive it was warm! And as I mentioned before, the romantic atmosphere was ruined by the fact I had to keep moving out of the way so they could serve our meal as there was so little space. At one point the waiter handed me my desert even though my main course plate was still in front of me - very disappointing service when I know the Fullerton is capable of much more. But the meal itself was delicious - very much up to the hotel's usually high gastronomic standards. The next morning we headed down for breakfast about 9am and it was like a circus. Packed to the ratfters and we had to wait 5-10 minutes for a table. Then they kept clearing away all our cutlery and glasses before we were finished, so we left without having our fill. So, whilst the Fullerton is really a very impressive hotel, I have to say I felt let down on service - especially considering its 5* status and expensive price tag. I really enjoyed our stay, but it certainly didn't meet up to my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to stay there every weekend.”
Reviews.Author: georgepburdell97
Reviews.Content: It's amazing that this hotel used to be a post office! Location is very nice - next to the water and other interesting areas in Singapore. Take a romantic stroll along the Singapore River. Buffet breakfast was not absolutely amazing, but still way above average. The room was clean, and the bed was very comfortable and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “ideal stopover”
Reviews.Author: Chocgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on our way back from New Zealand. We arrived in the evening and had a quay view room (as booked on Skoosh). There were some lovely fruit , flowers and chocolates that we didn't expect, but there was also a note addressed to another couple - they had obviusly reallocated teh room at the last minute!! Room was lovely with a nice marble bathroom , lovely furnishings and Molton Brown toiletries. The location was ideal for usas we had not really explored this part of town before (previous stays in Oriental and Sentosa Resort). We could walk to most attractions in the area and it certainly had a buzz with business people and locals as well as tourists. We ate in the Lighthouse Restaurant on the top floor. The staff were very kind and showed us round the roof terrace and took photos of us with our drinks. The food was nice, but expensive for what it was. A nice one-off treat for the view if nothing else (we were sat right by the window). Breakfast was superb in the Town Restaurant -- a truly international selection buffet. We also ate there on our last night. The seafood buffet was expensive but we made sure we got our money's worth before we had to leave for the long flight to London (well we are from Yorkshire!). The pool was small and crowded on our last day. We had arranged a late check-out (12pm) and left our luggage with the porter. We spend the rest of the afternoon by the pool and later retrieved our hand luggae to get changed in the spa facilities. A lot of others were doing the same! Very convenient thought. The Fullerton was just what we needed to round off our trip- convenient and a good location. I would definitely stay there again but wouldn't try the restaurants again - there are lots of lovely places within a few yards to eat and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Expected way too much more from the price of S$500/night”
Reviews.Author: asimplejazzlover
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I am a bit disappointed with Fullerton Hotel. It is overrated and overpriced too!! This is written based on my experience staying in this hotel but may be different to others. For the rate I paid for the room, I expected that the room would be a bit bigger. It is rather small albeit their amazing view to the Esplanade/Marina Bay. The hotel is lovely, the lobby is elegant though the reception is a bit hidden somewhere at the back I supposed. The pool, the gym, everything is a bit smaller compared to other 5 star hotels I've been to in Singapore. I tried the Italian restaurant on top of the hotel. The steak was gooood although it is very much more expensive compared to other great hotel restaurants which serve good steak also (eg. Morton's). Located a bit far away from the metro station so you should get a cab to the hotel. If you wanna walk down, it will be a bit of a walk, so forget it. Grab a cab! It is located opposite of the Esplanade, something I can see from my room (which is the good point of this hotel to me personally). The breakfast is awesome! Luckily they got it right, otherwise I would be very furious. HAHA! :) All in all, Fullerton Hotel is overrated and obviously is overpriced. If you wanna try the most expensive hotel in Singapore, get here. Personally, I wouldn't want to dip into another disappointment with this hotel, I am seriously not coming back. Try to search for other 5 stars hotel nearby. They have better facilities, better rooms than Fullerton. I've been to lots of 5 stars hotel in Singapore and this hotel has brought the standard of five star hotels in Singapore to a lower level to me, personally speaking. Swissotel the Stamford is much worth the value with its great spacious room and the views are much better than Fullerton, and it's almost half of the price in Fullerton rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, So So Service”
Reviews.Author: joeank84
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was beautiful, Room was great and the service at the front desk was great. We booked the Valentines day Special which included a Quay room, champagne, and dinner. We arrived early and they still accomidated us even though we were 2 hours before check in. Our only two problems happened when we ordered room service for lunch, we found plastic peices in our food, and When we were supposed to have our Valintines day Dinner, they seemed to have forgot about us. 2 hours later and multiple calls to the front desk to find out what was going on, We finally were able to talk to the manager, and He sent our dinner up promptly and we were refunded the cost of the room, with an offer to us to let them try again on making our Fullerton Experience the best one we could have.Although our Valentines day was ruined, The Hotel was great, and The Management fixed our only greivences, even if it was 2 hours late. I will definitely go back again and will recomend highly to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt beat the service”
Reviews.Author: The_Cloggs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stopped in room 701 overlooking the Quay for the start of our Honeymoon - great room and really enjoyed the variety of food on offer - the couple spa was fab too!! the hotel is in a great location to explore Signapore had to comment on the outstanding service we received there. from allowing me access to a top floor suite at night to take pictures to the comment of "please allow me to show you" proceeded by taking us to the business centre etc.. the courtesy bottle of champers also went down well

Reviews.Title: “Great location and view for the fireworks”
Reviews.Author: travelherenthere
Reviews.Content: We were so fortunate to be able to get a suite facing the fireworks. A few months prior to our arriving at the Fullerton I had been talking with the people at the reservation department. Her name is Vicky. She was most helpful. Knowing that there will be fireworks on the 31 Dec we requested a suite that would be on the higher floor facing the fireworks. There was no promises but eventually Vicky told us that it has been arranged. The months of emails writing was worth it. The view was incredible. Unobstructed view of the waters over which the fireworks was happening. Check out the pictures. We were on the 8th floor. As usual, we made us of the Strait Club which offered breakfast, afternoon tea and all. Free internet was included which was nice. The first night we got there both my wife and I took turns to look after the kids while the other went to the spa. We had the Balinese deep tissue massage, which was relaxing to say the least. My wife has a booking for the Head to toes treatment the day after, but she never made it as she got a cold... The previous stay at the Fullerton we never tried any of the hotel restaurants. This time we were at the Jade for three different occasions. We tried the Seafood and Peking Duck set dinners which were sumptuous though we couldn't really bring ourselves to liking the dessert "Green Tea Tofu Dawn Shitake Mushroom ice-cream" form the seafood set. But on a second night with another family, they gave it to their two year old who seem to love it...but then two year old, they eat anything sweet. Overall I think the Seafood set was better. We had the Dim Sum buffet as well on 1 Jan. I have to say, now I understand the rave. Its actually pretty good. The quality of the food is very very good. Kids under five eat for free. Overall there is nothing which we can fault the hotel. Highly recommended. Would continue to stay in this hotel until we find another that can top it.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore in Style”
Reviews.Author: kp_sydney_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fullerton for the first time after having visited Singapore many times,this was truly a step above the other hotels, with a great choice of rooms,our room,an esplanade room,on a high floor had views to the harbour. The breakfast on the terrace was always welcoming and the service exceptional. The location of this hotel is perfect to explore boat quay and many of the main city attractions.Would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but had a big fight to get free Internet access. Take your proof with you.”
Reviews.Author: markjay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in December 2009, choosing it over other top Singapore hotels mainly because it is a member of Preferred Hotels, membership of which offers free Internet access at participating hotels. When we asked for the password to obtain free Internet access the reception staff said that this wasn't offered. I suggested that someone come to check our paperwork from Preferred Hotels that mentioned this. The staff member came and took a photocopy of this and agreed to comp the S$29 daily charge - very high compared with our experience of free Internet access in most hotels in Asia.

Reviews.Title: “Trreated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: aiguebelle
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel to bits! We had a loft suite and from check in, everything was perfect. The Loft Suite entitled us to certain privileges at the Straits Club, so we were constantly popping in for champagne breakfast, tea and cocktail hour. Food was great and service was top notch, excatly what you would expect of a 5 star hotel. We were greeted every step of the way and nothing was too troublesome for the hotel staff. The room itself was also a nice touch. Very very comfortable beds, spacious toilet with bvlgari toiletries and also complimentary TWG teabags and a nespresso machine. We had a massage at the spa - not bad at all. We also spent some time at the infinity pool overlooking the Victoria Concert Hall - the view itself was worth the experience. Usually, when we check out a hotel, we will also make it a point to check out the surrounding areas but in this case, the hotel was such an oasis of relaxation that we didn't even bother to venture out. Will we be back? Definitely! We enjoyed ourselves so much that we are already planning our next visit back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: expatsing
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to pay us a treat and spend one night in the Fullerton on one of their local promotion for the Singapore residents. The package included a bottle of wine, 2 wardrobes, a 3 course meal in your room, and a breakfast. It was a little expensive, but worth the experience I think. Our room was smaller than I expected, however this is an old building so it was ok. The balcony could have been better furnished, but the view was superb, right on the Singapore river. Breakfast was amazingly good, and the hotel itself has a special cachet, and alot of charm. Beds were comfortable, meeting the expectations. Overall good experience! Worth the try!

Reviews.Title: “Top Class”
Reviews.Author: RestlessTravelBaron
Reviews.Content: Sometimes a hotel is just as a means of accommodation in a place you come to visit. The Fullerton is not that hotel. From the beginning, stepping out of the cab in front of an incredibly imposing building and entering a truly stunning and equally imposing lobby, you know you are not in an ordinary hotel. The rooms are not large, but the bed- the bed is spectacularly world class- massive and so very, very, very comfortable- it was not easy getting out of it in the morning. The bathroom is extremely roomy as well- as bathrooms go. But what sets this hotel apart is the service and ambiance of the place. The concierge is amazingly and most thoroughly helpful and knowledgeable. On the second day forward, the restaurant staff knew our breakfast juice and coffee preferences. Service is fantastic. Overall, the staff is extremely attentive without being obtrusive. The breakfast is wonderful- and incredible array of items prepared freshly and fresh squeezed orange juice by the bucketful. If you are there on a Sunday, the brunch is absolutely not to be missed- pricey is may be at S$150 a head, but if you can stand the pain of your own gluttony, it is well worth it. Not your normal buffet, but fresh oysters on the half shell, lobster, tiger prawns; excellent sushi/sashimi; unbelievably good curries, and on and on- all washed down with lashings of Taittinger champagne or spicy bloody marys. My wife insisted on the chocolate buffet on Friday and Saturday evenings, but save your money and go to the brunch instead- all that chocolate shows up there as well. Location is good if you like shopping- 8 million malls within walking distance, though the Central Business District gets a bit quiet at night. We stayed in this hotel after several weeks of fairly intensive traveling, so were more inclined to just laze around. We picked an ideal hotel to do this- and after 5 days were sad to go. I have read some of the negative reviews of this hotel, and know that one bad experience can spoil the whole stay. We were fortunate to have not had such an experience and can say that though the rooms are very nice- and not especially fantastic, the overall experience of the service, the wonderful lobby, the breakfast and brunch was from beginning to end a real treat. We would stay at the Fullerton again.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like a star!”
Reviews.Author: OverworkedUnderpaid
Reviews.Content: Almost pointless reviewing this hotel... it gets great reviews across the board! I was here for 8 nights on business, and from the moment I arrived I felt like a star. Check in was personalised and friendly. I was given a room on the executive club floor so I had complimentary breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktails and canapes included. What a treat!! A glass or two of champagne before popping out for dinner! Room was huge. The bed was massive! I felt like Alice in Wonderland climbing up onto it. The pillow menu was fabulous. My room though looked out over the internal atrium, so basically I never really opened the curtains. I was there for business though, so not in my room much (unfortunately!) Internet is payable. Bathroom fantastic with Molten Brown products. Nice touch. I used the gym a few times and found it to be very well equipped with 4 treadmills, bikes, cross trainers and even a spin bike. Lots of freeweights and space to stretch. As soon as someone finishes using the equipment somebody comes along to clean up. There are no windows though, and humidity is still high despite aircon. The pool is a dream. Proper infinity pool overlooking the Singapore river. It doesn't get the sun until about 11 am though (left hand side when you walk onto the pool area) and by 1pm the sun has moved so that it only hits the right hand side of the pool - where unfortunately there is only room for about 6 beds. That is a handy hint if its the sun you are after!! I didn't eat in any of the restaurants but I did have bar food and drinks in the Post Bar. There is a great terrace area which is beautifully lit at night, so you really get a feeling for the grandeur of the hotel. The mini burgers melt in the mouth by the way. Hotel is right on the river and about a 5 min walk to most of the financial business area. It is also a 5 min walk to Boat Quay with lots of bars and restaurants (including, oddly, a bar dedicated to Manchester United) Can't say enough about the quality of this hotel and the great service. It is actually a bit understated in some ways I guess... which just goes to show its pedigree!!! Its not flash.. it is pure class. Would recommend to anybody!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandhole
Reviews.Content: The service was great and the room was very nice. Very accessible for business travellers and a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Easily the best hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Janerty
Reviews.Content: The Fullerton Hotel is easily the best hotel I've stayed in (as compared to six other local hotels I've tried the past few years) in Singapore. Service was impeccable. Even my 2.5 year old toddler commented that the bellman was very nice after we were helped with our bags. I must say that everyone whom we’ve encountered – from the concierge to the front desk to the restaurant – was articulate, responsive to our needs, and had a wide smile to offer. We had a courtyard room on the fifth floor that didn't have a view at all. The room was basic, but the bed was incredibly comfortable. The buffet breakfast was extensive and really really good. The infinity pool on the second floor was rather small, but had a nice view of the Cavanaugh Bridge, Asian Civilisation Museum and the CBD. On a personal note, I would have liked it if the hotel had done a little more to showcase the rich and varied history of the building (cultural and historical tourism sells!). I’m sure that there is available literature on the subject lying around in the hotel’s gift shop for interested guests. But still, it wouldn’t hurt to have a permanent area in the atrium that showcases the past occupants of the building, salient architectural features, conservation efforts and so on.

Reviews.Title: “All show and no substance”
Reviews.Author: krugboi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fullerton Hotel for 2 nights a couple of weeks ago. The hotel itself is beautiful; it used to be an old post office but unfortunately we felt that the rooms were on the smallish side and very basic. The rooms are nice but they're a bit boring. The service left alot to be desired considering it is a 5 star hotel. There was just no warmth or friendliness. The thing that really annoyed us was that there was no complimentary wi-fi or internet access in any part of the hotel. I think it is inexcusable these days for 5 star hotels not to offer complimentary access. Especially as the airport and most shops in Asia do.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel on the river”
Reviews.Author: hongkongandsingapore
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel is excellent. It is on the river and is across from the museum and colonial buildings. The swimming pool is also amazing with spectacular views. The only thing to be sure of is to avoid the courtyard rooms since they are dark and not very welcoming. If you get a city view or river view room - then you will be very happy.

Reviews.Title: “terrible lack of service and non-responsive to feedback”
Reviews.Author: vcheese
Reviews.Content: am a local who dined there with my in laws. two staff walked off once they passed through the doors despite seeing us approaching with baby & stroller. grand welcome. we gave the name of the person who made the reservations 'Jack Frost' (fictitious) and the hostess curtly said she only has Jack, she has no Jack Frost. we sat down for a good 10 mins and nobody attended to us despite the restaurant being empty. we had to wait to get someone' s attention to give us a menu, and we had to wait again for someone to look our way to take our drinks order. a berry/prune from previous guest remained under the table (and made into a mess of my inlaw's shoes and floor), and a cutlery knife remained on the open floor of the restaurant yet nobody picked it up for a very long time (we refused to highlight it to the staff after the treatment we've been given). comment card submitted to GM, Louis Sailer, received no response. we walked away from the hotel with the feel they put so much pride in their physical property with its rich heritage and desire to be perceived as a high class hotel, that they end up with their staff being of such high class themselves that they provide no warmth to the guests. this is a no-return place for us.

Reviews.Title: “over hyped - no sunlight for 6 days - I was destroyed !!!”
Reviews.Author: bhagwan69
Reviews.Content: I stayed @ The Fullerton in Singapore for 5 nights. I was there with my wife & 9 year old son. Was in room 1616 - 6th floor. I had no window in my room & the only source of light in the room was a fixed glass that looked into other rooms - 10 feet away. I did not see the sun for the 6 days that I was there. The Bed was too high & getting on it & off it was a 'task' The Shower cubical was like a HK 3 Star Hotel - rather small. The Breakfast was the same for 5 days in a row - no change. Check in process was rather slow - had to wait in line [like a Bank teller] to get my turn - 45 minues. Was over charged for phone calls that I did not make - I always use 2 mobile phones when I travel - 1 to roam & another for the local number. This Hotel looks 9/10 from the outside. My room & experiance was a 2/10 & 3/10 respectively. I will surely not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel top class service”
Reviews.Author: gilmarsh2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fullerton hotel for 7 nights with my adult son. If you are thinking about a trip to Singapore, this is one of the top hotels, for comfort, style and service. the building is a beautifully restored post office. The staff were also second to none. They even gave my son a birthday cake, yes it was his birthday. I have stayed in several hotels in Singapore and I must say I could not complain about any of them, however, the Fullerton has that little something special. It is large enough to give you all the facilities you would expect but not so large as to loose the personal touch. It has a great central location next to boat quay and the famous Harrys bar. It is also very close to one of the MRT (underground train) stations, great and cheap way to get around. If I had to pick on one thing, the swimming pool, although adequate for a swim, is fairly small, with limited loungers. Not the place to keep the kids amused. Check out their web site this will illustrate my thoughts. Other than that, I would give The Fullerton a big 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “A leading hotel of Asia”
Reviews.Author: SkiBuzzz
Reviews.Content: When looking to book the Fullerton Hotel for my wife and I to stay for a few nights, I was wary of the extortionate room rates they can charge being THE iconic hotel of Singapore. I was pleasantly surprised to catch a great rate online, and immediately booked, having heard nothing but rave reviews from friends. I wasn't disappointed. The entrance foyer to the hotel is grand and stylish yet understated. The reception we received from staff was warm and friendly, and when we checked into our 'river-view' room the decor and fittings were incredible! Not to mention the wonderful balcony with a view over the old government house, and a huge bathroom with everything you could ever want - my wife was ecstatic. Nothing was ever too much to ask of staff, and the breakfast's we had were hands down the best hotel breakfast I have ever experienced. A massive array of choices and cuisines, and the produce was all so fresh. We loved it! This is, without a doubt, one of the leading hotels of Asia.

Reviews.Title: “A great renovation of a key Central Landmark”
Reviews.Author: jolly999
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is the former main post office building and has a huge atrium, with rooms running on the outside of the site. The location is fantastic, with subway entrance 50 yards away (important in Singapore where taxis can be a nightmare) and all the key businesses down the street. Staff very helpful, but as with nearly all five star Asian hotels, they try to compensate real "know how" with sheer numbers. Check out can be a problem as, again infuriatingly and in common with similar standard hotels in Asia, you have to have your credit card imprint taken again. Well worth staying and you will not in better in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss in the centre of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: scottvicks
Reviews.Content: Stayed here first night of honeymoon. Wow - when you enter it has the most incredible atrium as it is what used to be a post office. Beautiful colonial building right on the harbour. Sylvie a senior manager at the hotel knew our names when we walked in without any prompting and took us straight to our room - absolutely incredible and professional service and a great start to our honeymoon. Worth upgrading to the business floor/centre as the champagne buffet breakfast and afternoon tea is incredible as well as free internet access. Pool is stunning location. Main Sunday brunch is also highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “good but not special”
Reviews.Author: sw1963
Reviews.Content: Fullerton hotel is definitly a nice property and I keep on going because of its locations. The down side is the fact that staff is constantly changing and that does make the place a little bit could. Last year there was a young spanish manager who was always around making everybody feel welcome and he is not there anymore, same happens with the F&B staff... Hotel rooms are ok but definitly depends on which one you are located as there are very different one from each other. Buffet is ok if you like assian food but not impresive. Something really to recomend is the Brunch at sundays.... just something you have to experience. Overall it is a good hotel but with no soul... Definitly I would prefer the Peninsula in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Landmark hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Huskyrides
Reviews.Content: The former Post Office is now a gorgeous hotel in the centre of Singapore! Lovely decor, great staff and within walking distance of the commercial centre. The Merlion statue overlooking the harbour is directly behind the hotel with cafes, bars and restuarants. We arrived at the beginning of Chinese New Year and the park across the way was covered in decorations. It was wonderful. Mixing with all the locals and eating all the local food. Fireworks then set off outside the hotel. Great place. Look for where the locals are eating. We tried one of the food markets and the food was delicious and very cheap. You need to remember you are not in the Western World anymore and sometimes need to leave your hygiene habits behind. Just don't think about the way the food is cooked sometimes. I believe the new 'Singapore Eye' is now open within 10mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great building - rooms & service not up to par”
Reviews.Author: Greyrock
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel w/ clients for one night. Location & building are superb. However, the service does not compare to other Singapore hotels. Upon arrival, long lines at check-in. Finally left luggage w/ concierge to be ignored by waitress in lounge lobby. Breakfast service non-existant: Your S$ 45 bill arrives before you are even served a coffee. Request for sweetener took around 15 minutes to fullfill. Hotel lobby filled with tourists taking snapshots. Rooms are quite standard and look like any Hilton/Marriot/Intercontinental Hotel room. Nice feature is the small infinity pool. The hotel's business center charges a nominal amount to print your boarding pass - something that should be free in today's world (same as the LAN internet hookup, which was also not free).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, facilities and location”
Reviews.Author: padd1ngton
Reviews.Content: First time to Singapore and I've been spoilt!! The Fullerton is a gorgeous, historic building and ideally located for business or pleasure. I stayed over my birthday and somehow a beautiful birthday cake appeared in my room with the hotel's compliments. The only down side is there are a great number of bedrooms which have internal facing windows, so you look into the atrium lobby rather than outside - during a week long stay it got a bit depressing not having any natural light. Apart from that I couldn't fault the place, excellent service, facilities and location!

Reviews.Title: “great rooms. fantastic breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: roppongi
Reviews.Content: big rooms with comfy bed. everything you could ask for in a 5 star hotel. the freshly squeezed juice at breakfast was a nice touch. mostly business travellers here rather than guests having a holiday, but relaxing by the pool all the same.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its best”
Reviews.Author: greenhide
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in we were looked after, Upgraded to a loft room and with Club floor it was a perfect 2 nights to finish our holiday. The elegance and grandeuer along with the views were perfect. We walked around to Raffles to see what all the fuss was about and my husband was asked to leave the lobby because he was dressed in shorts and not trouses. None of that at the Fullerton where you wre made to feel welcome. Club floor afternoon tea was perfect with scones, bagets and salom and asweet biscuts and cake. Easy walking distance to Orchard road and along the river to lots of Singapore sights

Reviews.Title: “Wow - but not cheap”
Reviews.Author: Carlos2570
Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous few days at The Fullerton. The staff were brilliant and very very attentive. The rooms and the buffet breakfast couldn't be faulted. Beautiful roof top pool, though not enough seating and somewhat too small for a hotel of this size. Beautiful views of the city and a very handy location (trains, boats and buses). The only issue would be the price, but hey you can't have everything

Reviews.Title: “A very impressive hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Charlie1745
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Fullerton on the way back from Sydney with my Wife. I have stayed there on business before and decided to return as out of all the Hotels I had stayed at in Singapore on Business this was the most impressive and has an excellent central location. (The view of the hotel from boat quay at night is incredible) I was slightly disappointed in the service which is why i have not given this hotel 5 stars. It was not that the service was not good it is just they did not go above and beyond as they had done the previous time I stayed at the hotel. It felt like there was less staff in the hotel this time, which might be due to cost cutting caused by the credit crunch. Altogether though this is still a very good hotel and worth a visit...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the Marina district”
Reviews.Author: freqflyer1832
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Fullerton at around 7am after a 17 hour flight from Newark. The receptionist was very courteous and provided me with a room even with this early check in. Believe me, after a 17 hour flight, that gesture was really appreciated. The room was very nice and is what you would expect from a high end hotel. My only complaint was the size of the work table and the chair (not exactly a comfortable chair if you have to sit and work for many hours). The business center was also small and not that comfortable. But otherwise, everything from the friendly and efficient service, the location (close to Boat Quay), the bed, etc are all top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Pure relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: Jonvsjustin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fullerton enroute to Australia. I sought calm surroundings, good service and a central location. Fullerton provided it all. The hotel room was quite small but as a solo traveller that was fine, the pool was superb with fabulous views and a relaxing atmosphere. The service offered was 5* at all times. I also had some treatments in the spa - I recommend the Indonesian massage to any weary traveller! I left for the final leg of my journey relaxed and ready to party in Oz!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular and Stylish”
Reviews.Author: FionaNT
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Fullerton hotel for 12 nights for a convention. Upon arrival in the driveway I was greeted by name and escorted directly to my room by 2 staff members and checked in inside the room. I stayed in a Club room on level 4 which included breakfast daily and evening canapes. The hotel has a great location at Marina Bay and easy access to shopping and business district. The hotel has a great ambience with the restaurants and lobby busy all day, as the food and service is so good. What really set the hotel apart was the impeccable service. All staff saying hello and calling you by name was a great personal touch. Room was great with all the facilities you would expect of a 5 star hotel. I also went to the Day spa for a massage and body scrub and it was great.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view”
Reviews.Author: TomBamber
Reviews.Content: 3 days in Singapore staying at the Fullerton. Early checkin but room was made up as a matter of urgency so it was available at 10.30am. Upgraded to a room at the front with a balcony and view over the bay. A very fair sized room and bathroom with all amenities one would expect from a 5 star, flat screen TV, robe, slippers, plenty of hanging space, quality bathroom amenities - could not be faulted. Didnt use the facilities of the hotel. All staff friendly, efficient without being overbearing. Excellent location within 5 minute walk to the financial district, and 2 minutes to Boat Quay. Service excellent - no way I could fault it. Hotel is 20-25 mins from the Airport, taxi is circa SGD25.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Fullerton”
Reviews.Author: L8H
Reviews.Content: We have experienced The Fullerton for the last 3 years whilst holidaying in Singapore having been to their great Sunday Brunch at the Town Restaurant but we have never stayed. We got a great last minute deal and thought this would be a good time to try it out. We had booked a standard courtyard room and asked for a fold down bed for our daughter. When we arrived we had a warm welcome from Riana who advised us that they had upgraded us by two room types to give our family more space. Great! our second upgrade of the holiday having nevr had even 1 before!! It was a pretty painless check in and Riana showed us to our room. I could could beleive the size of the room. It was huge with a a seperate changing room/walk in wardrobe, a huge bathroom with rain fall shower, bath, double sink, the highest ceilings I have ever seen etc etc. We only stayed for two nights sadly and wish it was longer. The location is great right on the river, a short walk from the Merlion, the flyer, clarke quay etc. The Raffles Place MRT is only 5 minutes away. The hotel is a grand building inside and out and you feel like your in a 5 star hotel. It is in the business district so it is used alot by people on business. The pool area is small but is generallyy quiet and the views are very nice up the river. Perhaps we were lucky with our room upgrade but we do love The Fullerton and will be returning whether we stay or not.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, big bathroom, not so good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: vyam
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked grand and fabulous from outside, so I didn't expect the room to be that tiny. Basically, the COURTYARD room was just big enough to put a king size bed, a writing desk and a chair. However, the bathroom was quite big, I guess it's as big as the bedroom with a big shower room and a huge bath tub. The matress they used was really good, very comfortable. The place serving breakfast also looked very grand. Good range of food was served, looked great but tasted just so-so. The food was not hot enough and the cold drinks were not cold enough too. The swimming was not very large but got a great view of the hotel and the quay. The lady who checked us in was just like a robot, efficient but with no heart. Can't feel like we were welcomed to the place.

Reviews.Title: “Palace”
Reviews.Author: koolguysg
Reviews.Content: Fullerton Hotel is one of the hotels where you should be looking to stay , first have a look at the website of the hotel and you will be amzed of its appearance and tempted to stay over there. i was too tempted but happily i happened to stay there in a business trip so lucky..... the rooms are quite extra ordinary and so comfort . quite expensive too its around 350$ nett.... those who can afford this amt sure try this hotel :-)

Reviews.Title: “The Best Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pnreddy
Reviews.Content: The Fullerton hotel in Singapore is the ultimate experience in hotel luxury. The building itself is absolutely breathtaking. Housed in the Singapore’s 1900s central post office, the building exudes colonial splendor. I think the original building has had some additions to it as there is a very tranquil ‘courtyard’ feel to parts of the hotel, set against a very majestic backdrop. The grand spiral staircases add to the ‘castle’ feel. I absolutely loved this hotel stay! Here’s my breakdown: Location: The hotel, while being located ‘centrally’ is not located in the ‘heart’ of the Singapore shopping district. (Namely Orchard Road) That said, Orchard Road is within a 12 minute drive away. Also, the area surrounding the Fullerton hotel is not short on things to do. The Fullerton is withing walking distance world class stores and restaurants. It is also within short walking distance to Singapore’s landmark “Esplanade” and some of Singapore’s premier bars. Security: Top Notch. Singapore is one of the safest cities in the world, and even if it wasn’t this hotel makes it’s guests feel at home and within solace. Cleanliness: This hotel is absolutely spotless. It also has a pleasant lingering scent to it. Staff: Staff are incredibly professional, the best of Asian hospitality. Friendly, and very mindful of guests. Character: The best of “Old money” Luxury. Definitely among the best, if not the best in Singapore. Facilities: This hotel is five star equipped. Expect to find, spas, pools, jacuzzi, banquet halls, business center, meetings rooms, state of the art gym and star restaurants on site. Points to note: This hotel does not just offer world class accommodation but also a perfect venue for weddings, lunches, banquets, meetings… etc I highly recommend this hotel and rate as Excellent with no second thoughts.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location and Structure”
Reviews.Author: Mitwaa
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in very Centrally Located and all the attraction points are witing walking distance. The Hotel building is very nice like a parliment from out side and it looks very beatiful in the night. People who can afford can go for Holiday and Business both.

Reviews.Title: “Lap of luxury”
Reviews.Author: ShabbirMerchant
Reviews.Content: An excellent location, just next to boat quay, where you can go for some amazing dinners and opposite the merlion park. It has a fantastic starbucks just opposite at fullerton hotel. Service is impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Excellent Hotel - Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Darshans
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Fullerton during May 2009 for a 3 day business trip to Singapore. I have been to SGP before but never stayed at Fullerton. Its a lovely building to be admired with excellent location. Its few footsteps away from central business district and very near to hang out places like clarke quay and boat quay. My room got upgrated and the facilities and staff were excellent. I loved the fulsome breakfast in the morning. I have heard that their high tea is also excellent during the afternoon - though didnt get a chance to try it. All in all, i would definitely recommand this hotel for its ambiance, location and quality of service.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: luckyamin
Reviews.Content: Located centrally. closer to great hospitality by staff. well decored rooms- the balcony on the first floor makes for an excellent relaxing. food is decent but easy access to clark quay makes the stay much more enjoyable and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Get treated like a ROYALTY”
Reviews.Author: Shafort
Reviews.Content: Would you like to experience how it feels to be treated like a royalty? Then never hesitate to stay at Fullerton Hotel. From the time of arrival, we were given a very warm welcome by the Bell-boys, check-in was smooth as silk, personally escorted to the room by the hotel’s very professional “Guest Recognition Manager”. Our room was well-equipped & spacious, overlooked the wonderful River Quay & had large bed, baby-cot for our infant, TV had all the channels (especially the Football channel which helped me to watch English Premier league games over the weekend). The room also had a large working desk, mini-bar with extensive choice & ironing board. The bathroom was ultra luxurious with separate bath-tub & shower. Towels were supplied in-plenty. The hotel has its own spa, swimming pool overseeing the River Quay, lobby lounge, some restaurants including “Town Restaurant” serving sumptuous buffet breakfast. The hotel has its own fish aquarium which my son loved the most. Location of the hotel is excellent with close proximity to Clarke Quay, Singapore Merlon, Esplanade, Raffles Square & more. Nearby are also some good restaurants serving Thai, Indian, Chinese & Italian cuisine. There is a also 7-eleven about 3-4 minutes walking distance away. The biggest Asset the hotel has is its staff members. They are highly-trained, motivated, professional & really give their best in serving you. I would like to sincerely thank the most Kevin Singh (Duty Manager) who was outstanding & the rest of his wonderful Front office team for all their hard work in ensuring our stay was comfortable as ever and we look forward to returning to the hotel soon.

Reviews.Title: “excellent -straits club-highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: touramine
Reviews.Content: i recommend staying at the straits club-excellent service and good views of the river close to the mrt and easy access to the city.highly recommend the team at the club.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the heritage building”
Reviews.Author: MasterBlasterMumbai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Fullerton for about 3 days and the amazed to by the heritage building structure. It has an awesome enterance. I really like the location as it is near to the business hub and most of our clients are in closeby buildings. I enjoyed the brunch at Fullerton the most.

Reviews.Title: “faboulous fullerton”
Reviews.Author: champagneslut
Reviews.Content: ..its great hotel! tho i didnt expect the quay room that small, the athmosphere' is perfect , in room dining also good & the pool at hotel is my fave with a great view' , not to mention the sunday brunch with free flow champers ;-)' will come back again to experience the fab fullerton!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence is the byeword at the Fullerton.”
Reviews.Author: Suanphlu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fullerton Hotel in Singapore for two nights using their Straits Club floor and I can say without doubt this is one of the best, if not the best, hotels I have stayed at. As soon as I entered the hotel I was awed by the grandeur of the place, it is converted from a the old GPO and any alterations and additions have been sensitively integrated into the original texture and fabric of the building. The Straits Club suites are large and comfortable and the Bulgari complementaries are luxurious. The Club room itself overlooks the Singapore River and the old colonial civic centre - a magnificent location. A bonus is the complementary Champaign breakfast which is quite good and fairly substantial. The 2nd floor outdoor swimming pool too overlooks the river but provides privacy from any prying eyes. The service was exceptional in its attentiveness, every member of staff from top to bottom were unfailingly polite. I ate at the hotel's Chinese restaurant, Jade and had their signature dish - a seven course duck extravaganza. It was a magnificent treat starting with a superb Peking Duck and continuing through a range of duck meat dishes. This is a must for any lover of duck. The Post Bar is lively and has a large collection of Singapore Sling-type cocktails again a delicious surprise and tapas-type nibbles are available as an appetiser to a meal at the Town restaurant or the Courtyard. While I was staying there the Town's executive chef had a feature in the Straits Times on healthy food. But whether you choose healthy or not at the Town the cuisine is unsurpassed. I can fully recommend the Fullerton as a world-class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: Flo_thetraveller
Reviews.Content: I visit Singapore often for business, and often stay at the Fullerton whenever i am there. The hotel is located in the heart of the business centre, and within walking distance to Boat Quay (although not that short a walk). The staff are extremely helpful, and it makes staying at the hotel after a long day of travel and meetings a pleasant experience. The rooms are spacious with comfortable beds. Check-outs and check-ins are quick. The pool is not very big, but does offer a nice view and a good place to chill for a while. Overall, I'd definitely recommend this hotel for business travellers. However, if you are travelling for leisure or with a family, there may be other options.

Reviews.Title: “The best house east of Vienna”
Reviews.Author: travelbee2008
Reviews.Content: Though our experience at Fullerton was not that immaculate - the A/C wa broken and it was very chilly in the first night - all issues were solved promptlz and with grace and friendliness. It is a splendid, wonderfully situated property with an outstanding cuisine and generous rooms. The Asian cultures Museum is next door, the Chinatown and a metro station - all are just a short walk away. One of the absolutely best hotels I ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault this hotel at all!”
Reviews.Author: Missjane06
Reviews.Content: This property has to be one of the best in Singapore - for hotel quality, location and most of all service! Having stayed in plenty of hotels in Singapore previously we weren't expecting anything too different from the usual efficiency and decent quality of the hotel. From the moment of our arrival we were both blown away with the attention to detail and service quality. We were upgraded to a Loft Room (which I highly recommend) on arrival which was then followed through with chocolate covered strawberries and french champagne as we were on our honeymoon. An errant tour bus was tracked down for us proactively by the Bell Captain (we didn't even realise they had forgotten to pick us up!) The breakfast buffet provided fresh squeezed juices on demand and a healthy range of options. The only small challenge was working out how the shower worked and the guilt I felt every time I walked past the stepper machine provided in the bathroom (I was on my honeymoon after all!) This is a property that is well worth it, especially if you can find a deal online! Just book it...it was pure class in what can be a fairly clinical city!

Reviews.Title: “one of the best”
Reviews.Author: familymanHongKong
Reviews.Content: We recieved a welcome upgrade which may have biased our view, we had 2 of the largest rooms.The staff were extremely friendly & efficient, breakfast is a buffet of good quality & we tried the seafood buffet which was both great value & great quality, both meals can be taken outside overlooking the river. The location is great for the local bar area & the central business district both on the doorstep, although those wanting to shop may favour an orchard road hotel. The only small negative comments I would have was perhaps the curtains could provide better 'black out' to prevent the early morning sun & the floodlights at night from the casino construction site across the bay(no noise was audible during our stay) plus the pool was a little small & cold(although quite empty during our visit)

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: flaming_lamborghini
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time I have stayed at the Fullerton and it will be the last. When I checked in I reminded Reception that I had a 6pm check-out the next day, and please make sure that House-keeping don't keep knocking on my door trying to make up the room, like they did the last time I stayed. Anyway, of course they did it again anyway. Then, when no-one answered their knocks, they slipped a note under my door saying "your laundry is ready for pick-up"!!! I hadn't even submitted any laundry. (the note was supposed to say they wanted to make-up my room). When I checked in, the room was freezing so I turned off the air-con. Six hours later, it was still freezing. Having lived in Singapore for the past several years, I did not have any pyjamas with me. I was freezing in bed, so rung up Reception and asked someone to come and fix the air-con. Two men came up and had to enter the ceiling to switch off the valve. This was completed AFTER midnight and by this time I was freezing and absolutely exhausted. I had to sleep with my dressing-gown wrapped around me, socks on my feet, as well as a sheet and doona over the top. (remember, this is Singapore, where even top-sheets are usually not needed) Then, the message light kept blinking on the phone. I rang up to retrieve the message, but there was no message! The operator assured me they would fix the blinking light. This happened 7 times!! Eventually, they said someone would come up to the room........ they didn't turn up! Later, I had to call up and AGAIN ask for someone to come up and replace the phone. Many of the time I had to ring Reception and Concierge, no-one answered the phone. They also screwed up my breakfast order. So, how did the hotel atone for this? An apology when I checked out....that's it. This is not good enough. I particularly chose the Fullerton, so I'd get a good night sleep before flying red-eye the next night. If you are reading this, Fullerton management, a simple apology upon check-out is not good enough. At the very least, some sort of compensation should be offered, even if it's just paying a small part of the bill. I am going to be angry about this for a long time to come.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel with spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Adithepv
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fullerton from 28Sept08-1Oct08. This was after the Singapore Grand Prix event and my company reserved this hotel as it is walking distance to the office. The hotel lobby is huge and very luxurious. The single room was very spacious by Singapore standards (but to be honest I don't know the exact type of room since I didn't reserve or have to pay for it). Had a chance to try out the fitness room, which was also good. Ordered room service (the lamb, fired rice) and the food was delicious, in fact one of the best hotel foods I've ever had. Service was also fine - somehow the turnaround times at the front desk and concierge was fast despite the numerous hotel guests. All-in-all, very satisfied with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bad start but finished well”
Reviews.Author: Robert-J01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Fullerton for two nights as a stopover on a trip back from Rome. We stayed at the Fullerton last year with our two young children on a stopover on a trip back from the Maldives. The service was superb on all fronts and as a result we elected to stay again. We arrived early in the morning after an overnight flight. This was naturally before check in so we were quite relaxed and understanding that our room might not be ready. Mind you on the last visit we arrived similarly early and they happily put us in a temporary room. At the check in desk, it seemed that the lady handling our check in had a room ready and was going to put us in it and when she sought to, clear it or whatever they do, with her supervisor. Unfortunately the lady on the desk saw it as an “upsell” opportunity and highlighted that our room was unavailable, but a higher quality room was if we would like to book it. The extra cost was to be around S$500 compared to the room we had booked that was S$400 per night. For a few hours this didn’t seem all that worthwhile and we declined. Sensing something a little odd with how this unfolded, I asked if the hotel was 100% full and I was told yes. My wife and I then went and rested on the couches in the lobby. Very comfy they were and in 5-10 minutes my wife was out like a light. A further 10-15 minutes later, I guess this was noticed and a room was made available straight away. So with a little delay we were in a room and after a short nap we headed out. On return we were in our room, it was on the 7th floor with a balcony and view over the Boat Quay. The fit out of the rooms is superb and styling is very nice. Seems to me the styling of the rooms is a little more in keeping with the colonial/heritage nature of the hotel as compared to the lobby, which seems a bit out of kilter with the colonial/heritage nature of the hotel – a bit more modern when a heritage/colonial approach would have suited more. The view from the room and the balcony was also good. Breakfast was included in our rate and was very good as well. We used the pool and gym, both excellent, and the pool with a great view of the Boat Quay. We think the heritage nature of the building coupled with the location (particularly if in town for business which we were not) is what sets the hotel apart from many others. It also seemed to be pretty good value. A really good hotel, just the one annoyance at check in. Would we return. Yes. Might stay somewhere else for a change, but not because the hotel was a problem.

Reviews.Title: “A grand hotel but the courtyard rooms are overpriced”
Reviews.Author: horhay
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Fullerton a few times over the past year in different room types. There is no doubt the Fullerton is a grand hotel with all the grace and amenities you'd expect from a top notch 5 star international hotel. The staff are formal without being stuffy and everything appears to run very professionally. The hotel also has a superb location right on the Singapore river, in the middle of downtown, with the Boat Quay and Clark Quay strips literally minutes away by foot, and the Colonial District and the Esplanade complex also directly across the river via a small 19th century footbridge. On my most recent visit I tried one of the base grade courtyard rooms for the first time - keep in mind even these base grade rooms can come in at the better part of US$500 a night including breakfast. The room was furnished to the same standard as all the other rooms I've had there and have almost all of the same amenities - but no i-pod docking station for example. As the name suggests these rooms look into the hotel's huge internal glass roofed atrium. I was on the second to top floor of the hotel so very close to the roof and I found this let in plenty of natural light notwithstanding the internal view but I dont know how well this would work if you were on one of the floors nearer the ground floor. What I did notice was that this room grade is smaller than the others and I know you can get much larger rooms in other 5 star hotels in Singapore with an outside view for less. With 2 people and their luggage in the room there is still room to swing a cat - but only just. The other thing I noticed is that in the afternoons there is a pianist playing in the lobby which is great - except that the music is very audible in the room which wasn't great when you have jet lag and want to rest during the day. All up, still a real institution of a hotel but in my opinion the courtyard rooms do not offer good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Location,”
Reviews.Author: max2lucy
Reviews.Content: I stayed two weeks at the Fullerton for business and give it overall high ranks. First, the location is excellent, in the central business district and a within a block of the subway system. Second, the service is excellent, with prompt responses to all needs. Staff is very friendly. I had a basic entry-level room facing the inside atrium. Its pretty quiet unless there is a reception in the atrium then it can get a bit noisy, but that was for only one of the nights, so really cannot complain. Only other drawback for the room is that you can't tell what kind of weather to prepare for (i.e. rain, sun etc.). The only drawback with the room is that the hotel is starting to show its age with some of the fixtures. I noticed plug-ins/receptacles were starting to come loose and one of the telephone jacks was broken. These are minor issues and are the only real area of criticism. Rooms, common areas and facilities are all very clean. In terms of amenities, room service and restaurants are all very good. The pool is really nice, with an impressive view day or night. Its a full 25 meters and is open at 6.00 AM until 11 PM. I went almost every day before sunrise and often had only one other person in the pool. The spa is also very nice, although quite expensive, but again the atmosphere and professionalism are top notch. Overall a great location, (quiet area, but only 4 stops away from Orchard Road Station, so its good for business and shopping), great staff and good food. It is by no means cheap, but seems to provide pretty good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Fabbie Fullerton”
Reviews.Author: jugsholme
Reviews.Content: Fantastic visit to Singapore was crowned by staying at the Fullerton. The service was understated while being efficient and charming. It is in a great location and totally unique among the hotels in Singapore - neither in a time warp nor a modern tower clone. The accommodation was as you would expect, comfortable and plush, huge bed, vast bath, super water pressure with lots of attention to detail. Good coffee machine, Bose docking system, soft robes, pillow menu etc etc all made our stay nicer. Breakfast choices were delicious, the restaurant staff were very attentive and the terrace where we chose to take breakfast has a good river view. The chambermaid greeted me by name in the corridor which I thought was amazing and this typified the service and care we received. I can't imagine wanting to stay anywhere else when next in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Top Corner of the Fullerton!”
Reviews.Author: JChua
Reviews.Content: Being a local Singaporean, and having visited the Fullerton Hotel when it was still the General Post Office of Singapore in the 70's and 80's, we had wanted to see the transformed Grande Dame of Singapore but could never find the right time. When we needed to get away for a short weekend break, we have decided upon this Neo-Classical gem of Singapore. Having booked the Palladian Suites at half the usual rate for a Sunday check in (only S$540 before taxes), we arrived at 1.30pm. Suite wasn't ready then, and we were being ushered to its Straits Lounge for a coffee break. 15-20 minutes later, we were told by the Receptionist that our suite was ready. Having merely requested for a " Higher floor suite ", we didn't realised we were being allocated a historical corner suite, room 777, on the 7th floor of the Hotel. This suite, as highlighted on its website, is where our former Minister of Finance's office used to be. This ultra quiet suite certainly has lots of WOW factor - possibly being only one of its type in this hotel, it has a 4-5 meter long balcony, easily accommodating 8-10 people, facing the ever-changing beautiful skyline of the Marina Bay of downtown Singapore! What a sight! We were really happy for what we were being allocated . Though the sitting area, which was separated from the bedroom area, wasn't huge, it was certainly comfortable even for 4-6 adults. Bedroom has a huge King sized, high bed, looks and does feel very very comfy. More surprises were to come - huge walk-in wardrode area, followed by a gigantic bathroom .... easily 900-1000 square feet for this beautiful suite! The suite also has these amenities - two flat screen Panasonic TVs with 30 TV channels, coffee and tea making facilities, kettle, free champagne, huge plate of fresh fruits, big box of chocolates, mineral drinking water, Bvlgari toiletries, iron and ironing board, etc The swimming pool on the 2nd floor, though quite small, was perfectly formed for a short and scenic swim, in the midst of downtown CBD, Singapore. The included buffet breakfast, at its Town Restuarant, was also very wide in choice and variety, and quite yummy, too! Check out their Western, Chinese and Japanese breakfast items, especially those Danish pastries! All staff, from housekeeping (who offers a few types of pillows to choose from and a fantastic turn down service) to Receptionist, to Conceirge, to Restaurant staff - they all seemed very professional, well-trained and happy working there. Location wise, couldn't be better - walking distance to Boat Quay where there are loads of bars, cafes, seafood restaurants, the Esplanade theathre with its Gluttons Square food court (not to be missed, only 10 minutes stroll from the Hotel), Singapore Flyer (15-20 minutes stroll from the Hotel), Marina Square shopping arcade etc. All in all, we had a wonderful short break at this famous landmark Hotel. Whenever we need a short weekend break, we will not consider anywhere else, except the Fullerton Hotel! Cheers & Kudos to the Management & Staff of this great Singapore Hotel - keep up the good work and we will be back, soon!

Reviews.Title: “well-designed layout, but avoid courtyard room”
Reviews.Author: Ikura
Reviews.Content: The good: - nice room design: spacious all-granite bathroom, big desk and good work area, 50% larger than normal rooms - beautiful fruit basket on arrival - far more than I could eat - lovely bathtub and shower, though sides of bathtub were so high that it's hard for a short person to get in - close to Boat Quay and food market The bad: - courtyard room had no view, no sunlight, and subjected you to the elevator-style music played live in the afternoon - carpet felt damp and sticky; same with chair upholstery - desk chair too low for desk - expensive internet access - no towel racks and no option to reuse towels and not change sheets - environmentally unsound Overall, I've preferred other Singapore hotels. However, a colleague who had a room with an outside view said it was an excellent room.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind damp bedding then this is a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: twogaijins
Reviews.Content: I've never felt strongly enough to review a hotel in all the years I've used this site, but the Fullerton changed all that.This hotel is a beautiful building and ideally located in the business district. However, there are some serious issues with the dampness of the hotel. After a few days of mild dampness, we started noticing that paperwork was damp to the touch, and our clothes (in the wardrobe) were also damp. The bedding, even inside the bed, was by the third night unacceptably damp, accompanied by an overwhelming smell of dampness, causing us to complain. We were shown 4 other rooms ending at midnight, when we gave up and went to sleep in our dank bedroom. The highlight of the 4 was a room on the front of the building which did not smell of damp like the others, but which had condensation 'inside' the double glazing, obscuring the view of the very noisy road below. We checked out this morning and moved to the Fairmont. Instantly more friendly than the staff at the Fullerton, I felt welcomed right away and have been upgraded to the executive floor. I have a view of the water and the city, a balcony, and DRY BEDDING. What more could you ask for.
