I wouldn't say never stay at the Fullerton as it is a nice hotel in a good location, but make sure to complain right away if you have any problems with dampness and make sure they put you in a room to your liking. PS: The 4th floor seemed particularly prone to the smell of damp. Perhaps one to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Fullerton 'sweet' for baby”
Reviews.Author: suitedealer
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from 6 nights at the Fullerton on an extended stay with the Suite Weekend Deal and were very impressed. The room offered a separate bedroom and almost 100 sqm of space with carpeted floors perfect for our 9 month old baby. Only pain was that there were 6 stairs down from the front door to the whisper quiet apartment with river views of Clarke Quay precinct and Museum & Bridge. Suite deal include access to club lounge and breakfast with Tattinger champagne that can be had downstairs in the main room with more breakfast choice and river views if desired. The breakfasts were extensive and had options of Cook to prepare what you want re eggs and omlettes on request. From 6pm til 8pm you can go to the lounge and have as much Champagne or cocktails as you wish whilst enjoying buffet sushi and canapes of a very high standard including Asian and western options. The staff are friendly, english speaking and will go out of thier way to assist you. Internet is free in room and on the club level. The Fullerton is in an excellent position and if you book a cab fom the room , one will appear in 5 minutes in the foyer and you just have to provide your booking number. $2.50 sing booking fee and about another $5 to anywhere thats imprtant in SIngapore such as Orchard Rd, Suntec City shopping or the fabulous VIVO City shopping Mall near Sentosa that you must see. You ca walk in 5 minutes to the underpass that links Metro stations and walkways to the linked malls if you ca stand the Singapore humidity. Fullerton Hotel is well maintained and definately 5 star but being a newish (8 years) hotel in an old building there are a few issues and compromises that are only a problem if you look for them like high windows and some water damage in walls of room but no mould smell. Bvlgari toiletries, granite tiled bathrooms and two LCD tv s and DVD in room. Room service food is excellent and cheap..just stay away form alcohol and buy it at shopping malls for a fraction of the price. A $18 (after taxes) local beer is hard to swallow in the room! more like $3 at the supermarket. Highly recommend this hotel and got a rate of under $US450 a night so excellent relative value. Good on you Fullerton, keep up the high standards. Remember to find the best rate on the hotel website then ring for a better deal..it works for most hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: cristianonyc
Reviews.Content: Forget all the reviews, the beautiful architecture of the building, The Fullerton is too big to deliver the luxury you expect from a 5 stars hotel and from the price you pay for your room. The staff has no personal attention , simply there are too many guests to help ! When you enter the property you really feel to enter a post office ( what the building used to be before the rennovation in 2001 ) and not a luxury property !!! My room on a higher floor with view of the river , was not better than a Novotel room. Small, very average decor , cheap furniture. The staff don't speak proper english , but a local slang. If you expect luxury and attention this is not the place to stay !!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous service, luxury accomodation”
Reviews.Author: QBowser
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a difficult trip and in desperate need of relaxation and some serious pampering, we have stayed in various hotles in Singapore but the Fullerton is the best so far. Service is exceptional without being too grandious. Came back thoroughly refreshed.

Reviews.Title: “An interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: BobHadden
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a quay room which was unusal to say the least, very high ceiling with a tiny window. The pool area is very small & can become crowded. Breakfast was excellent as were the staff throughout the hotel. The complimentary birthday cake I recieved was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: bestthingsinlife
Reviews.Content: First time in Singapore on business - excellent all round. I upgraded to a port view - well worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it - tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Wolrdwide
Reviews.Content: It was my first, very much anticipated stay at the Fullerton. Would I stay again? No, but then I am a big fan of the Ritz-Carlton in SGP and I was disappointed by the Fullerton. Firstly, I was disappointed by my room. A large number of rooms go to the inside court ie no proper daylight. I asked to be given a room with daylight (not necessarily bay view). After a lot of checking, I was offered a room abt $75 higher then my corporate rate. I told them I like a room at my corp rate where I can see the sky and was then given a room with city view. Unfortunately, it was right next to an office block and as the Fullerton is not very high I needed to keep my curtains closed at all time to avoid the feeling that somebody looked straight into my room. I guess I should have settled for the court view as the result was the same, drawn curtains and no sky. The room in itself was pretty but not particularly spacious (although the bathroom is huge) and a lot of room was taken by a large desk. As there was not that much space the luggage rack with my suitcase was pretty much always in my way. This room is too small if there are two of you. The building is a converted post office and ceilings are also not very high, adding to the feeling of a small space. Obviously, the hotel has also bigger rooms – just I was not in one. At check-in I enquired abt internet connection and was told all the info is in the room. In the room I found a general info booklet, however, it refer re internet to another publication. I could not find the relevant info and in the end I just used my laptop when I went to a Starbucks (free WIFI in SGP). The gym and pool neither impressed me. The pool is on a small concrete plateau (3 or 4 floor) with a pretty view over the river, but there is little space around the pool to sit and hardly any vegetation. It rather has a cramped feeling and it is not a place to stay for long. The Ritz in contrast has a tropical garden which almost makes you forget you are in a city. The gym is okay but not particularly big, nor pretty. I only tried the restaurant for breakfast which is very beautiful and has an airy feeling. You almost could think you are in the South of France. I very much liked it as it did not have that big business hotel feel to it. Overall I would not recommend the place and was very disappointed. While it is silly to whine abt a 5 star hotel, in this part of world you get so much more for your money, why bother with the Fullerton?

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary.”
Reviews.Author: adviserrr
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay. The hotel has a fine location and the building is one of but a few in Singapore that has some character. However, everything else about the hotel - rooms, reception areas, service, food - is 3 rather than 5 stars. On the rooms, they were in poor state of repair - some of electric cables by the desk were taped together and the furniture very worn. On service, it was interesting the hotel randomly upgraded just one of us (my collegue and I travelled on the same booking company), my wife could not get through to the hotel despite ringing several times and when she got through, was put on hold and disconnected (when queried about this, the hotel explained that one of their operators was on leave), the front desk staff were just not great. On food, the club floor breakfast was limited (2 choices of cereal?) and the main restaurant was again just not great. One final gripe - the vast and impressive lobby areas had many tables and sofas but most were tagged as "reserved" (for who?) and most tables had dirty cutlery, cups etc. It was pretty obvious that the people who had the coffee/food had long left the tables - simply unsightly and poor hygiene. All in all, at these rates, surely it makes more sense to stay somewhere consistently reliable like the Shangri La or the Mandarin Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “Unsurpassable service”
Reviews.Author: RunningGirl
Reviews.Content: Having been slightly put off the hotel with some mediocre views, it was with a little trepidation that I booked the hotel, having always wanted to stay there due to the amazing setting on the Singapore River. From start to finish, we were thoroughly impressed. The service was just unbelievable. We were shown round our room by the front of office manager (a quay view room, which was very spacious) and couldn't have had more done for us. Our deal included free bathrobes, a lunch in the Town restaurant (where the buffet was the largest I've ever seen - including a fresh seafood section, sushi, Western food, etc), wine and the hotel even provided us with a complimentary bottle of champagne. The room was a good size, with electric curtains, lights, huge walk in shower and with a balcony overlooking the river. The pool was beautiful - with a seated section along one side combining the pool and jacuzzi! I can't rate this hotel highly enough, and would definitely go back again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Only just worth the money”
Reviews.Author: WharfTrader
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a weekend in March - hotel is a beautiful old buliding - make sure you ask for a room with an outside view as otherwsie you are looking into the lobby/courtyard - check in was poor - made me wait until official time and then room still wasn't ready - but in fairness they apologised and upgraded me to a duplex suite - room was enourmous - big terrace as well (though overlooking the road so a little noisy) - was very clean - no problems with service after check in debacle; very friendly and professional - pool is fantastic but does get busy so get there early - only had one meal there in the lobby bar which was good - location is arguably a little out of things, though you can walk to boat quay (not great) and clarke quay (much better) - so overall probably just about right for the service/location -would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good But At This Price I Need to Mention It's Faults - Esp. Taxis”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveller123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel this weekend on a 1/2 price Suite offer. The accommodation was spacious as was over 2 floors, with a nice verandah outside between the large pillars. There are many positives to the hotel that should be as the room rates are high, but the experience is not quite as good as it could be. Positives, negatives and summary below: + Nice location, no big deal getting to places if you can travel by cab and if you can get one Generous offer - 1/2 price off suites at weekends New and modern - decent LCD TVs, room remote controls, nice amenities, espresso machine etc. Suite nice and spacious, decent sized verandah Speedy check in and check out _ Club lounge closes by 8pm, also generally only 1 staff on duty so response time too slow Getting taxis from the hotel was a complete shambles. The bell captain was enforcing a system whereby taxis would pull up and decline to take passengers unless they were going to be large (mainly to the airport) fares. We spent 10 minutes in the heat waiting, then had to threaten to complain and were then offered to pay an additional fee to the driver to convince him to take a local fare Breakfast not especially nice - buffet style, and much better quality at Valley Wing at Shangri La where things cooked to order Would have made more sense to have additional room controls for the curtains, do not disturb sign etc. downstairs in the suite as well as upstairs No TV in the bathroom (pendantic admittedly but the Valley Wing had this) Summary: Very nice stay with a few minor quibbles and one major concern regarding taking taxis. We would stay there again to take advantage of such a nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Full Marks to the Fullerton! What a star!”
Reviews.Author: RE-VeeL
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Fullerton was fantastic! I booked into a City View room expecting to see an office building or yet another air conditioning vent and was amazed that I could see the river and Clarke Quay from my balcony. The size of the room was very generous and spacious and all furnishings were plush and top quality. The double wardrobe was supplied with at least a dozen coat hangers and the valet stand were fabulous, it really made me feel at home! The marble bathroom was enormous and had generous bench space at the sink and mirror, seperate toilet, shower and large bathtub. The infinity pool was only about 1.2m in depth which was a surprise (I thought it would be deeper), however the view was breath-taking...to swim and lounge by the pool with the view of Singapore River was a real treat. The gymnasium and sauna facilities were also top notch. I could rave on for hours... My verdict: If you can afford the exie rack rate, it is definitely well worth every penny! PS - I had the best berry and dragonfruit danish at the buffet breakfast that has ever passed my tastebuds...the pastry was melt-in-you mouth and the fruit were deliciously plump. Absolutely divine!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing : great service cannot compensate for cramped rooms”
Reviews.Author: Targetsea
Reviews.Content: Soft side of this hotel is very good. Service excellent everywhere - from the front desk through the restaurants to housekeeping to the concierge and doormen. Really very good. And its position on the Marina is pleasant - bit downtowny, but really OK. The hardware - the room - is just nowhere near where you should be if you are aspiring to five stars and charging SD 410 ++. Our room was tiny with the bed taking up 80% of it. If there are two of you in the rooom, one is going to have to be on the bed. You expect this in older Japanese hotels, but not anywhere else at these rates. Other hotels in Singapore are more spacious and cheaper. As others here have commented, the mattress is hard. If you like hard, fine. Personally I could not sleep. Not helped by airconditioning that struggles to keep up with demand. So warm and humid nights spent on an uncomfortable bed. Bathroom is better - about the same size as the room? Has most of what you would expect, but materials and finish just not first class. Furniture in the room getting worn as well. Nice large cups for making tea or coffee. But the hotel information books bound in leather had swollen into the wooden slots in their drawer and could not be pulled out. Interior atrium public space is generous. Elsewhere the design of the building means the swimming pool and coffee terrace are squashed in between the hotel and the sidewalk. I was trying the Fullerton to see if it could improve on my usual Singapore hotel. Won't be going back. However good the service (and it is very good) it can't make up for the lack of comfort in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic- make sure you stay there”
Reviews.Author: eumundi
Reviews.Content: This is our regular stay over hotel in Singapore. The standards seem to improve on each occassion, if that were possible. The staff are trained to the highest level and the service is "world standard" Such superb value for money. Breakfast s are superb although we tend to eat dinner out at Singapore wonderful selection of restaurants. A must stay hotel if the wallet allows.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful lobby”
Reviews.Author: intreped
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fullerton for 5 nights on vacation. Booked the Easter Special, which was still about $350 per night with taxes, so not cheap. The room was a tad cramped but otherwise very nice. The bed was very firm, which I prefer, but if you like a pillowtop mattress it may be too hard. The bathroom was extremely nice. Try to book a room with a river view, which is much nicer than the "sea" view which looks over the highway at the harbor, and directly across you see the forest of cranes building the new casino. Also, try to book a high floor. The breakfast buffet, which was included, was extremely nice, with tables outside on the riverfront. The pool and health club are also very nice. I especially appreciated the pool because it is good for lap swimming (25 meters). My wife I would get there at 6am (before sunrise) and have the whole pool to ourselves, which was heaven. Don't have the hotel arrange a pick-up at the airport. It costs about 4x as much as a taxi and we had to wait 20 minutes for the driver to show up (after phoning the hotel), who then complained that we were late. The location is ideal, just a short walk along the river to the Raffles subway stop, and you can walk to lots of great places from the hotel. Overall I would recommend it, especially if you can get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CHabroad
Reviews.Content: Was in Singapore in Feb on business and my usual hotel was full so I booked into the Fullerton....and I'm very glad I did. The check in was swift and professtional and the lobby of the hotel was very grand, clean, well laid out etc. I went to my room (which I think was 210) and wow! what a view. The room was lovely, very comfortable bed with all the other amenities you would expect from a 5 star hotel. I opened the double doors to the balcony and it was just above the front entrance of the hotel over looking boat quay. It really was stunning. Only downfall was that it was shared and the coulple next door didn't really respect that (I won't go into more detail!). Anyway, the location was great and as I was only in Singapore one night it was a great base to do some exploring and take in some lovely sights. I drank in the bar downstairs, great service and great drinks. I didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment..but I'd be confident that if you booked this hotel you'd love it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 5stars hotel! A truly luxurious and elegant hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Charmainee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far the best hotel i have ever stayed in! I and my boyfriend booked one nite under the Valentine Day promotion. At check in, we were personally walked to our room by one of the reception staff. There is a bouquet of flowers already waiting for me in the room! We were given the Quay room which overlooked the Merlion and Singapore Flyer. At night when the different colour night lighting comes on, the scenery is breathtaking. My boyfriend and I spent a good deal of time at the balcony chating while admiring the scenery... The room is beautiful with a very spacious bathroom. The bathtub can easily fits two person..We were given a selection of bubble bath scent to choose from and tealights. There is a wide flat sreen tv, DVD player and a bedside remote control operating the lights, curtains, clock & alarm The pool is small but adaquate. It overlooks the beautiful Boat Quay and Singapore river. Great for relaxing... Next we enjoyed a in-room four course dinner. The food is good.. When we requested for an extra chair, the staff is happy to bring one up promptly. The location is also great. It is very near to the Boat Quay or Clarke Quay which is one of Singapore's famous nightspots. It is also only 10mins walk to major shopping centers like the marina square and suntec city (also a convention hall) and arts center like the Esplanade. Or you can just choose to walk a stroll by the the marina bay and enjoy the seaview.. The breakfast buffet is only fair. Overall, my boyfriend and I had a wonderful and fanastic experience staying at this hotel. All the staff we met are very friendly. Although this hotel is more expensive than most other hotels in Singapore, the service, room, down to amenties received is worth every extra penny. We truly felt pampered...

Reviews.Title: “The Reviews Here Are Well Deserved!”
Reviews.Author: 01ofvisadventures
Reviews.Content: A definite must stay travel destination. Historic and filled with culture dating to the 1920’s. The stately columns give it a distinguished feel and the lighting adds to a rather majestic feel. I found the service to be unsurpassed here. If you asked for the gift shop, you were not just pointed in the general direction; you were taken there. I had gone shopping, and the doorman insisted on carrying my packages to my room for me. I asked for change for tipping; they RAN (literally) to get it for me. It was actually a bit overwhelming and bordered on excess! Outstanding attention to detail was present throughout the property. There are antiques and artwork scattered throughout the property. The gardens were well maintained. The guest rooms are spacious and well decorated with high-end furnishings and linens. Bed was comfy, although the comforter could have been a little heavier for my liking. They do have a “pillow menu”, and I could have asked for an extra comforter. The website states that bath amenities are Bvlgari. They were not. They were Molton Brown~ still quality amenities. The location along the water is dreamy and nice to be able to walk direct from the hotel onto the river walk and see all of the sculptures. This hotel is billed as a 6 star hotel. I could compare it to many 5 star hotels I have stayed in. I suppose the historic nature and attention to small things could be the reason why it is rated 6 stars. I felt that some nice wool rugs and decorator pillows could have made it feel a little less austere. I do have to agree with the guest who stated that the executive club was hit or miss. I enjoyed the Marriott Orchard Executive Club much better. If you are all about pomp and circumstance, you will enjoy this very much. I tend to like to pick and choose when I want to dress up. It felt a bit more like a requirement here. I am including photos of the room for your review.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but dissapointed at the hotel food”
Reviews.Author: Sakuraii
Reviews.Content: I was in Singapore for business and stayed at the Fullerton because its close to my office building. Service was excellent, staffs were friendly and helpful. In my personal opinion food wasnt the greatest at the Fullerton. I tried a variety of things but none appear to be exceptional. There are many local food outlets around which makes great food at a fraction of the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel in landmark building”
Reviews.Author: HardieBoys
Reviews.Content: Spent a night at the Fullerton in January 2008. It's a former colonial-era post office that has been extensively renovated for use as a luxury hotel. The staff were efficient, pleasant and attentive at check-in and check-out, with no major problems in service noted. I'd read some reviews on Tripadvisor that had commented on the service. The room was large, with a very large bathroom. Bed and other furniture was comfortable. The bathroom has two doors, allowing circulation through the space; the WC has a separated door. Overall it felt spacious. The pool is good, and from the terrace, there is a pleasant view of the river. It's a surprisingly shallow pool, given it's length and breadth. The gym is good, with a range of resistance and cardio machines. It will allow a reasonable workout for most. Dumbbells go up to 50 pounds. The hotel is located in a pleasant riverside site. As most have mentioned, it's right on one of the quays. It's right across the river from the excellent Museum of Asian Civilisations (which I highly recommend). No major negatives, other than it can take a few minutes for a taxi to arrive, and it's not particularly convenient to Orchard Rd. We had a corporate rate, which ended up being around 50% of prices listed on Tripadvisor. At the corporate rate, it's obviously good value, but I don't know that I would have felt it particularly good value at retail rates. Whilst I enjoyed my stay, I'll probably stay at the Stamford next time (which has a better gym, and is closer to Orchard Rd, Raffles and so on).

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable luxury”
Reviews.Author: allergymom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fullerton with my husband and 6-year old while I was in Singapore for a conference. We stayed in a _huge_ room on the 8th floor--plenty of room for my son's free rollaway, could have easily held another. The bed was very comfortable, and the room was incredibly quiet. The bathroom was also spacious and had a tub and a separate shower with a rainshower fixture; the toilet was in a separate connected room. The walk-in closet/dressing room allowed me to get dressed for my conference while the guys slept. (Our room was very clean, unlike one of the other reviewer's.) We all loved the breakfast buffet, included with our room--a huge spread that included many Asian, American and continental favorites. The pool was great for my husband and son; it never seemed to have many people in it. Everyone else's posted photos do the place justice. The hotel is in a very convenient location--a short walk from the Raffles Place MRT station, not much farther to the edge of Chinatown. Easy commute for me to my meeting and for my family to tour Singapore. Staff were all very pleasant and helpful. Just wish that internet was provided free, and that all the service charges and taxes that are tacked on to the room rate were quoted up front.

Reviews.Title: “The Fullerton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Serge29
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed 3 days [4th-6th Jan '08] We were met by a limo on arrival & taken to the reception area. An upgrade [room 477] provided us with a spacious well-appointed room with a spacious bathroom, with separate shower and separate toilet. A wide-screen TV was present. A bedside remote control operated the lights, curtains, clock & alarm. The executive lounge whilst present, was a poor second to that at the Mandarin Oriental. The staff there were pleasant but the service was erratic - they were often absent from their station. The main restaurant, serving modern Italian cuisine was well worth a visit. The pool, on the 2nd floor was also pleasant. The check-out, was better handled, by dedicated staff on the 4th floor, avoiding the necessity to go to the main area on the ground floor. The concierge was very helpful. The Fullerton i a good location for those wishing easy access to the Singapore River Quays for dining, but is not convenient to the Orchard Rd shopping malls.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Fairies
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful hotel, such a beautiful building from the outside and such a grand foyer with marble columns and fresh flowers everywhere. The staff and their service in this hotel is outstanding. We stayed three nights here in one of their deluxe rooms – very spacious with a lovely balcony area overlooking Boat Quay. The only time we ate in the hotel was breakfast (as there are so many restaurants to choose from outside the hotel – between Boat Quay and Clarke Quay alone – you will not go hungry) – but their breakfasts were gorgeous. We would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Wereldreizigster
Reviews.Content: The Fullerton is a good hotel with nice rooms, this time we received an upgrade and the room was really big, and clean. The bed was big and full with nice pillows.. Roomservice meals are good and breakfast is sumptious! The fruitsalade was wonderful! The pool is great!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: RINSO84
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights. The hotel has a most fantastic location. All the staff we met was all super and friendly and we had a fantastic room looking out onto the Singapore River/Boat Quay. We had emailed months ahead that one of us needed a gluten free diet and at check in reception confirmed that all was in hand, within 5 minutes of arriving in room we had a phone call from restaurant checking on gluten free diet. from then on the restaurant was fantastic catering for gluten free, dishes cooked specially and bread turning up just after you had given your room number. We had two superb dinners in the restaurant, it was great. Any problems, none except the quality of the service and hotel standard means we want to go back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Not coming back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: AlexanderJames
Reviews.Content: dirty bathoom and a customer service class badly required for all front desk service staff. stayed at the historical hotel in late september. the rooms were dirty and had fungus-like stains in the bathroom. seek housekeeping's assistance to remove the stains but it was not done. called for assistance again at the front desk after dinner at the town restaurant. they did not even look interested to help. the heritage building is nice but to bear with the dirty bathroom and poor service staff is a no no.

Reviews.Title: “Just magnificent”
Reviews.Author: marilees
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely stunning. It was clean and the staff were ultra efficient. It was magnificent. The price you pay is worth every cent. If you have the money you should definitely stay here. It was beautiful and had everything you would need.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: frednuff
Reviews.Content: I have previously stayed at the Hyatt and Ritz in Singapore and the Fulerton is a quality hotel. I have no problems to report (even with the reportedly cold reception). Food is good (room service fairly quick), pool has a nice setting, service is typically Singapore, location is great for meetings at the CBD banks. Of the 3, the Hyatt on Scoots Rd is my favourite but the Fullerton is a good alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better...”
Reviews.Author: charliebroucher
Reviews.Content: I was told the hotel was the number 1 in all of asia but was shocked to find out that all these was far from number 1. I arrived on an evening flight after a long time on the plane from london to be greeted by lazy bellman and cold receptionist. It was a totally blown off experience. The bellman was not carrying my bags properly and my toiletries came falling out of my bag. The receptionist was terrible. Didnt even looked at me while handling my check-in formalities. During the stay, I asked for directions to the train station as I was rather interested to find out more about singapore's underground system. I approach this tall duty manager who had an english name but looked indian to me. He wasnt very helpful and brushed me off as he was busy on his cell before handing me over to a malay girl who's english i couldnt understand. Luckily there was this staff who could help me and he showed me the way to the train station. As i was pretty much disturbed, I did not take down the gentleman's name. It was later upon my return to the hotel in the evening that I realized he was a security staff. as told by the concierge that the security staff wore grey. I am grateful to that staff who helped me out of that situation. If it was not for him, I would not even think of visiting the fullerton. Front office services were really bad but at least there were other staff who showed that they care. Hope that I would not have to face the same cold services again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Fullerton!”
Reviews.Author: fabholslover
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Fullerton. Its a beautiful hotel from the outside & has a very impressive lobbey area. Looking around Singapore we felt that we had made the right choice as it felt very 'special' in relation to the other, somewhat 'impersonal' , more modern 5 star hotels. Have to disagree with people who thought the reception staff were 'cold' we found everyone very friendly (especially the club staff - they really couldn't do enough for us). We had a 'Palladian suite' which was very nicely furnished with a spacious, well stocked bathroom. Everything was clean, bright & of high quality. My husband especially liked the coffee machine and the huge range of coffees which came with it & my daughter loved the comlimentary box of chocolates!!! Club lounge was a bit lacking in atmosphere as mainly used by business men but what can you expect in a city?! (however, canapes very good as was the champagne!) All in all a great hotel in a fabulous location - would certainly stay there again. (By the way we were not that impressed by Raffles when we visited - preferred the Fullerton)

Reviews.Title: “Good room, bad reception”
Reviews.Author: FilouSG
Reviews.Content: I really liked the call center of the hotel, they were lovely. When I arrived, it was a rather cold welcome. Check in like in the supermarket. I was disappointed like the guy from KL and I understand what he meant. The room they gave me was good unlike his, I had a wonderful view, but I had asked for it. Maybe if you tell them, they give it to you. I loved to stay in the room, big bathroom, excellent room service, fast internet. Nothing to complain about. But the reception, they need to fix that. I don't understand how you can have an excellent call center and a reception that mechanical.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location....shame about the 'working girls'”
Reviews.Author: Princess_Denise
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the Fullerton. I have tried a number of hotels in Singapore for business and the Ritz is still my favourite. The Fullerton is lovely but as a business woman I was completely put off by the 'working women' in the Post Bar. I stayed at the Fullerton for 7 nights and had post-dinner drinks in the Post Bar on at least 3 occasions. Each time there were 'professionals' sitting at the bar. It wasn't too obvious, and they certainly didn't prey on any of the guests. But for someone who has travelled around the world and lived in Asia for numerous years, I can spot them as quickly as any man. On one occasion, my colleagues and I watched as a single man worked his way around the bar until he could find one that agreed to his offer. The hotel staff knows about the situation but turn a blind eye. If you like a bit extra with your martini and peanuts, then stay here. As for myself, I am trying the Shangri La on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Needing Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: SydneyKeen_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Fullerton in mid July for business. Have normally stayed at the Oriental or Raffles Plaza hotel (although have also stayed at Pan Pacific and Mandarin in the past) but company's travel agent managed to get a better corporate rate at the Fullerton. Pluses: - good location for business as walking distance to major corporate offices - beautiful public areas: renovated heritage building; bar serves good selection of wines by the glass and endless nibbles - good, substantial but expensive breakfast spread (breakfast spread is more interesting and of better quality than Raffles Plaza and Oriental) - efficient staff (but like most Singapore hotels, cold compared to staff in 5 star Bangkok hotels) - good huge bathroom with separate shower (although toiletires could be improved) Negatives - need to take taxi to get to shopping areas; nearest attraction is Boat Quay which is overly touristy and not good value for food - not walking distance to MRT station (which on a hot day and at peak taxi periods is a bit annoying) - rooms are small and showing age: was given a courtyard facing room (which was rather claustrophobic); room interior design is "bland international, corporate"; TV is small and old CRT (sound system into bathroom was not working); no DVD or CDs Overall, would stay in the hotel again for business due to location and ability to get competitive corporate rates. However, for a 5 star leisure trip, would stay at another hotel as the Fullerton hotel rooms are rather disappointing. Would still recommend visitors to come into the hotel and have a drink in the lobby / public areas. To date the Oriental Hotel is overall the best hotel for me to stay in Singapore although the best rooms to date are the refurbished rooms at the Raffles Plaza (ask for the ones facing the Raffles Hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Super pool, average breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Finlo
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Fullerton on business, having had it recommended by many other people at work. It's certainly an imposing building, with efficient porters at the taxi drop off, and a grand atrium. Check in was well handled and I was escorted to the most convenient set of lifts for my room. It seems a hike depending on where you are - it's a deceptively large floor area! The room was a good size, lovely bathroom with a good range of toiletries, tons of storage and my personal favourite, good lighting. For once I took advantage of the pillow menu to get something with a bit of body - swiftly delivered, though they never took any away so the bed ended up 50% pillow. The pool's great, with a good view out towards the Merlion Park. Restaurants - the "international buffet" was pretty miserable, and I wasn't greatly impressed with the quality of the breakfast buffet, though it has to be said there was plenty of choice. Coffee was appalling. There was a good range of fruit juices available; the standard orange but some unusual blends of freshly squeezed as well. The buffet restaurant is split level - you need to balance carefully with a laden plate on your way back to the table if you've ventured up to the upper level. The Chinese restaurant was pleasant enough, but I felt decidedly unwanted as a lone female diner. Transport - a couple of minutes walk to the entrance to the Raffles Place MRT along Boat Quay. You may actually be able to get there underground, but never quite worked it out. The taxi point gets VERY busy in the evening - if you have an evening flight and the hotel's held your luggage, you'd be wise to get them to book your car as you check out.

Reviews.Title: “Style at Fullerton”
Reviews.Author: travelagentkids
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our five day stay at the Fullerton,the hotel is extremely stylish.As I am a travel agent we were greated with a fab upgrade to a suite.Even though this is a five star proberty the prices within the hotel are very reasonable.We were travelling with our children and the babysitting was very reasonable also.I must agree with some of the reviews with out being to over the top the breakfast is not the best we have had but good all the same. The location of the hotel is also great overall I would recommend this hotel be careful when you read some reviews as some people can be very painful take a look at the star rating from a travel agent brouchure rather than the internet in making your decision on all hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, unique and intimate”
Reviews.Author: Aliciacch
Reviews.Content: A completely renovated old post station in a fantastic location with an intimate flair. From the huge flower arrangements to the delicate patterns on the floor, the pool overlooking the river and the high ceilings, it is THE HOTEL in Singapore. Some of the rooms are small and we booked through asianrooms and had to change once we were there. Fortunately they had other rooms available. Ask for room sizes! the pool is fantastic with a view that is unique almost in the middle of the city. Walk around to the museums and financial district and the river. if you want to go shopping, need to take a taxi. We also hired a driver to go around the island. worth it! I used to go for a walk very early, a spectacularly clean city. if you like walking you can go many places from the Fullerton.

Reviews.Title: “So very so so...”
Reviews.Author: snwong4848
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last in 2003 for 5 nights and remembered that I left impressed. However this time, the hotel is starting to show its age. The check-in was "cool " to say the least. No one showed me to my room or helped me with my bag. Admitedly, I only had a small bag but perhaps I would have like to been offered a choice. The room looks really tired and since I had the courtyard room, there was no view to talk off. In fact the room was on the small side and if I remember correctly, looked exactly the same 4 years ago. Having paid quite a lot for the room, I was also surprised that they have not upgraded the TV to a plasma/LCD. I also could not figure out the odd looking shelfing in the room with 3 ugly jugs and a wierd looking photo. It really looked out of place in the room. However the major plus of the place were the wonderful housekeepers, the room service waiters and the conceirage. But would I go back? No, when for the same money I can stay in the Hyatt or Fourseasons or Ritz carlton.

Reviews.Title: “We love it very much”
Reviews.Author: LuciaLEUNG
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights.A tremendous suite is very clean, a bath tub and a shower with 2 big mirrors, we enjoy it much , and also spend there for the 4 days all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at The Fullerton”
Reviews.Author: Designer2001
Reviews.Content: Our recent 2-day stay at The Fullerton was a TRULY WONDERFUL experience. From the booking of the room about 1 ½ month prior to the date, to the time we checked in and out, everything was professionally & more importantly personally taken care of. My wife loved the special touches (the flowers & candles) that I had requested to be provided in the room. My 2 daughters also had a fantastic time just staying in the room & ordering room service. They are wondering when we will be going back for another stay. We look forward to a return stay sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Still needs to be improved”
Reviews.Author: doggieluver
Reviews.Content: I stayed here four years ago and did not have a good experience. I recently stayed here again because all my favorite hotel in Singapore--the Ritz Carlton--was fully booked. The outside of the hotel looks very nice and so does the pool. Yet, the service really is way below average. The rooms are very small too. I think the front desk staff, the housekeeping staff, and the business center staff all need to go back to hotel training school and re-learn basics. Beware that a lot of rooms do not have an outside view--the windows open to the lobby! I don't know how the Fullerton can claim to be a 6* hotel. I heard from busines colleagues that, since its grand opening, the Fullerton has struggled to compete with the Ritz, the Four Seasons and Raffles Hotel. Yet, it is still not preferred by most business customers. I now fully understand why.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maddog2000
Reviews.Content: The Fullerton was exactly what it promised: A very good city hotel. It is definitely not a boutique hotel, but it still has an edge on design. Rooms are very comfortable and relatively large (when compared with other city hotels). Location is excellent – you can reach the business district and the nightlife by foot or taxi within minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gumboots
Reviews.Content: What can I say, I think this is the best place to stay in Singapore! For location you simply cannot beat it. The most scenic areas of Singapore are at your doorstep, for lovely late evening jet-lagged walks, or for swims with views of the skyscrapers looming above you in the eternity pool. I was surprised to see other reviewers say that the service was not up to scratch - for this was the area that particularly stood out about the Fullerton. We stayed there for a week, and consistently found the staff extremely helpful and charming. The doormen were particularly friendly, always with a ready smile to welcome you back at the end of the day, it started to feel like home! The impression I got is that the management have really got things right, because the place ran like a well oiled machine - super efficient, yet still managing to be friendly and welcoming. Check-in and check-out was seamless. Concierge and restaurant staff likewise were always on the ball. The exterior of the building is far more interesting, attractive and historic than many of the other hotels in this category, possibly only with Raffles to compete on this score. But I would still give the Fullerton the edge, as it is a real landmark. The interior of the building is lovely. The flowers were always interesting, beautiful displays. I loved the tall pillars of the atrium, and particularly enjoyed watching the fish in the Atrium pool. The rooms werea good size, very comfortable, absolutely no complaints. The bathrooms were spacious and with great attention to detail in the design. Being a courtyard room, it wasn't the sunniest or brightest, but this was clear from the start. There are lots of interesting places to visit in walking distance, lest you be put off by the fact that it is in the city centre - it is by no means geared only towards business travellers. For dinner I particularly enjoyed the 'hawker stalls' next to the Esplanade theatre. The shop houses are nearby, boat cruises, and for everything else you can just pop into a convenient and cheap taxi! We had the Seafood buffet at the hotel and found it to be excellent. The Fullerton gets 10 out of 10 from me. I would not hesitate to recommend it. It was an absolute pleasure to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as it us to be”
Reviews.Author: MiltonMiami
Reviews.Content: Have stayed few times at the Fullerton for the past 4 years and overall experience has been disappointing during last 2 visits (end 2006 & early 2007). Won't recommend this establishment anymore, eventhough the building and location is unique. Accomodation was just fine. But definitely a drop in service & food quality (restaurant + breakfast!). No real effort made on that side compared to other hotel in Singapore which have now renovated their main restaurant. Even the famous Post Bar is not as great as it used to be.

Reviews.Title: “could be much better”
Reviews.Author: dbasha
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 night at the Fullerton recently, filled with anticipation based on various reviews and photos that I had seen. However, I was in for a disappointment. While the public areas of the hotel were beautiful, and the room and bathroom were large and impressive, the hotel is let down by the average service levels of its employees. The hotel's employees seem to have forgotten that the hotel's past reputation alone cannot sustain its future, parrticularly in a country filled with hotels known for their excellent service. One glaring example was when I checked in and was wrongly given a smoking floor room. I then pointed out the error and asked whether it would be possible to be placed on the same non-smoking floor as my colleague who had checked in seconds before me. However, I was given a room on another floor without an explanation or even a response to my request. I had to actually ask whether all the other rooms on my colleague's floor were full, to which I received a curt nod. Incidentally, when my colleague went up to her designated room, to her shock it was already occupied by someone else - definitely not the kind of mistake you would expect of a top notch hotel. The other staff I encountered were generally pleasant but not particularly warm, making their pleasantness seem rather artificial. I must however single out Tania at the concierge's desk, who was genuinely warm and truly helpful - she stood out a mile from her colleagues. The other thing I should note is that the breakfast buffet was disappointing in terms of the variety of food available. Having stayed at the Intercontinental late last year and experienced their superb breakfast, I can safely say that the Fullerton's spread is sadly lacking in many respects. Overall, given the high rates that the Fullerton charges, I think they should make a concerted effort to ensure that their service levels improve.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: barolobrain
Reviews.Content: December in Shanghai is not a great experience so with the office closing for the week between Christmas and January 1st, we decided to go to Singapore. I liked the location of the Fullerton the best out of all the better hotels in town, close enough to Boat and Clarke Quays and Raffles Landing, and nearby the junction of two Metro Lines. Check in was painless and the room was as requested with a balcony and view of the river. Unless you're a hard core shopper who must be right on top of Orchard Road, the location's good. The other cluster is where the Ritz-Carlton,Oriental, Pan Pacific and Marina Mandarin are located, all nearby to Raffles. I did check out Raffles during out stay, nice for historic reasons but the rooms are a bit dark for my tastes. We ate breakfast everyday at the hotel. The buffet's very good but not the best I've ever had. As always, the egg/omlet man was either a feast or famine situation. One day, perhaps Christmas day, they moved the breakfast to a function room in the basement. It was not a good situation and being only two, asked us to share a table or wait forever. If not raining and not in the basement, one can also eat outdoors which is quite pleasant. Other than breakfast, we did not eat at the hotel. The hotel bar is quite nice and further, they make excellent drinks. Well mixed with generous pours. Hotel itself, like many places in Singapore, is non-smoking except for the bar and perhaps some designated guest rooms. Rooms have broadband connectivity and mini-bars. One odd thing was that the AC, needed for the high humidity, would power down along with the lights when you took your room key out of the power slot by the door. I found this rather perplexing given the local conditions. Staff were very helpful in sorting out anything. Whether it was directions, finding a restaurant or tourist destination, getting transport, etc., they were efficient. I rate this hotel highly for its location. The physical facility and staff are also first rate. Here's the downside: They need to sort out the A/C power being connected to the room's mains switch. They also need to 1) refurbish the main eating room where breakfast is served and 2) spruce up the breakfast offerings and also make the buffet itself more attractive and user friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not the best”
Reviews.Author: Woodai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fullerton for 2 nights on a business trip. I live in HK and have stayed in many 5 star hotels in Asia. I must admit the Fullerton was "5 star" but not the best 5 star hotel I have stayed at. There were very few travel amenities in the room. They had the usual shampoo/conditioner/shower gel/moisturizer/sewing kit/etc. but no welcome fruit, no good night chocolate or note, no other freebies. I guess I was disappointed because they placed literature on your desk on how they're one of the best hotels in Asia but I didn't feel like they went out of their way to make themselves "the best." The breakfast buffet was good but again, nowhere near "the best."

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Expectation”
Reviews.Author: CSFSHY
Reviews.Content: We stayed in several hotels in Singapore throughout the year it's the first time we stayed in Fullerton. Because of it's location, we chose this hotel as we wanted to be close to the countdown where the fireworks will be when the clock strike 12 on 31 Dec midnight. Our arrival onto the hotel was a disappointment, the porters were nowhere in sight. The taxi driver and my partner brought down the luggage from the boot whereas I went around looking for porters. Finally, found them at their desk behind the pillar. 1st dissappointment. The check-in was just like another regular procedure, there was no welcoming message from the front desk. It was like just another routine check-in for her. We booked an Atrium 'Sun-lit' room due all other rooms are fully booked. The room decor was alright, nothing fanstastic. The so-called sunlit room was not lighted up by the sun at all. It was dark in the room throughout the day unless we turned on the lights. Worst was that I found a cockroach in the bathroom on the 2nd day. Luckily, it was very still on the wall, if it flew around the bathroom, I would have fainted! Called the housekeeper and got rid of the cockroach. Talking about the bathroom, the quality of the towels given were lousy, they weren't thick nor gave you a luxurious feeling. We stayed in several hotels in Singapore before, I must say the really impressive one is Ritz Carlton, you should have compared the bathroom amenities between the two hotels. Talking about service, Fullerton is nowhere comparable as well. Our check-out was just another standard check-out procedure. There was no 'do visit us again' message. Overall, we feel that staying in Fullerton, you do not really feel welcome, you don't feel warmth at all. Personally, I think this hotel is over-rated. The cockroach incident was really an 'exceptional experience' we have in a 5-stars hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Looks good but cuts corners.”
Reviews.Content: This was the third hotel I stayed at during a trip to Singapore. The Fullerton building is beautiful and the location is convenient when working in the business district. The front desk, restaurant and bell service was helpful and efficient. The room service left a lot to be desired. They once delivered someone else's food. I was disappointed with everything I tried except the sushi and the great bloody marys. The hotel rooms were nice but you could see where they cut costs. Cheap soaps, the sheets could have been nicer and the odd configuration of the rooms is annoying. The desks where not very comfortable for working. The two rooms I stayed were hard to navigate. Furniture was and fixtures where in strange juxtaposition. I kept finding myself bumping into things. Make sure you do not get the cheapest rooms. They either look over the atrium, which is fine if you have an aversion to natural light, or they're tiny. The Grand Hyatt (club level) had the best room. Great layout with a closet that opened to both a large bathroom and the main room. The desk area was comfortable, ergonomic and even had a desk plate with AV hookups for VGA, S-Video & RCA to the 40in plasma and room sound system. The Four Seasons had excellent service, great food (much better than the Fullerton) and nice spacious rooms. The bathrooms were very large. The price was also right, less than 2/3 the price of the other hotels. I wish I would have stayed here for the entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Caroline1043
Reviews.Content: I stayed in 3 Singapore hotels in the space of a week this December and the Fullerton wiped the floor with the competition. The location is ideal, near the MRT, which is in turn only 10 minutes from Orchard Road and also a short stroll from Boat Quay for dinner and nightlife. I would also recommend the restaurant for having a good mix of cuisines, although the wine list is pretty expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Keslergo
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't really stay here if not for my brother who was also in Singapore. It's quite far from Orchard, which makes shopping a bit of a chore. The rooms were fantastic, we stayed at the Heritage Room which was on the top floor with a nice walk in closet to keep all the stuff tidy. The hotel looks stunning at night especially when all the lights were on, It's worth a try but I doubt I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Shant
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Fullerton with my wife and 3 year old son on a three night stay in Singapore in October. The arrival was perfect; all of the staff were excellent and attentive, however, I had booked a room with either a sea or river view; we received a room with no view, except that of the pillar at the side of the hotel, however, to their credit, they swiftly changed our room and apologised unreservedly. I was impressed with the way in which reasonable (though a little small) sized rooms have been carved in to a historic building. The rooms provided everything you needed for a relaxing stay. You get exactly what you see on the website. I would not say the rooms provided anything exceptional for a five star hotel, but I have no complaints in any way at all. The staff were absolutely excellent. My wife, son and I accidentally stayed on in the pool one night, about 20 minutes beyond it's closing time. Rather than disturbing us or informing us of his presence, the staff member remained indoors, in a location where we could not see him, and he waited to lock up until we had left. The business centre staff went the extra mile to find the difficult services that I needed. They also arranged for a scientific poster to be printed for me within 20 minutes. The deli/cafe staff are excellent too, and made up some special food for my son. The concierge is wonderful and mapped out a host of things for us to see, do and eat. However, the restaurant staff are a little hit and miss; some were excellent, some were rude; also, we booked a room with champagne breakfast included, and there was no champagne at breakfast (not that we would have had champagne at breakfast). The location is excellent. The hotel is a few minutes walk from the metro, cabs are easy to get, and the walk along the river is fantastic in the evening. The pool is amazing. It's not huge, grand or exceptional in any particular way, however, you will be awestruck when swimming in it at night. Looking out whilst swimming, you have an amazing view of the city and the beautiful river walkway. You become awestruck and just remain at the side of the pool once you notice this. This may not sound impressive, but you must experience it; and if not for anything else, stay at The Fullerton for this alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect service”
Reviews.Author: misstripreviewer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Fullerton whilst in Singapore in a multi-centre trip. The service was impeccable, from the initial meeting directly from the plane on arrival to our equally attentive send off. We were greeted everywhere by name and had personal check-in in the room . Made us feel valued and very comfortable. There was no pomposity, just friendly attentive service. Our quay view room was perfect and the small balcony allowed us to enjoy the view. The pool is beautiful although the sun deck is quite limited and might get crowded on sunny days. We managed to get breakfast included in our rate which was very beneficial as it's pretty expensive but excellent. We didn't have dinner in the hotel but did have cocktails in the bar - busy and lively in early evening. I do recommend the hawker's markets for eating, Glutton's Market is just across the bridge near the theatres. The food is good, lots of choice and very cheap. Good place to people watch and get closer to the real Singapore. Boat Quay is good for casual eating whilst Clarke Quay is a bit more pricy and bit more "hip". Only downside was that we were there during the "haze" which is caused by the fires in Sumatra so we didn't see the sun.

Reviews.Title: “totally professional”
Reviews.Author: padmall
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip for 5 nights. I cannot fault it. A great location for business, and leisure traveller alike. An amazing atrium /reception area, good rooms and a great pool and gym area. The staff were helpful as one would expect. I can recommend particulary the Indo-Chine restaurant on the opposite side of the river, and the jogging path from the hotel toward the airport along the shore to work off the stress of the day. All in all, worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “What an outside pool and a view on the river !”
Reviews.Author: Wykx
Reviews.Content: I advise you to obtain a room on the river and to use the swimming pool outside. This is so wonderful. The service is nice. Rooms are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: ANON5000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed her as part of our Honeymoon tour of the Far East. We had a fantastic three days; the hotel itself if very opulent and sophisticated, the service is excellent and we were really looked after. Our original room was quite small as was a corner room with a reduced floor plan but after asking we were upgraded to a Heritage room overlooking the pool which was wonderful. Singapore was a great city to spend a few days and lots to do, hotel is well positioned to tour the city and sits in a very grand position overlooking the river and out to sea. Would definitely stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: rex_edmund
Reviews.Content: Excellent views and great facilites. They also have a great restaurant. Bathrooms are huge and the bed is exceedingly comfortable. Great Service from the staff too. Higly recomended. The only draw back is that its a bit far from most places as it is close to the central business district in Singapore. Overall a Great Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Solid but not superlative for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: beijau
Reviews.Content: I have spent two months out of this year at the Fullerton. I have marvelled at the architecture, savored the food, and on every stay, I have lamented the mis-cues. If you are visiting Singapore from outside of Asia and looking for a centrally located and aesthetically pleasing experience, you will probably enjoy the Fullerton. Business travelers may find some nits to pick, but on no account will they feel uncomfortable or unloved. In a part of the world where the market for five star hotels is highly competitive, I feel that the Fullerton tries hard but not quite hard enough. To be sure, the rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff are competent, with the odd exception of the wait staff at Town restaurant. Housekeeping in particular does a great job. Transportation is efficiently arranged, and the concierges know their art. What doesn't work as nicely are the touches that frequent travelers expect to reduce the hassle of living away from home. Retro-fitting a historic building for modern purposes is challenging, and management cut corners here. The room decor was clearly done on the cheap. Trying to find a free plug for both your computer and mobile phone requires a few minutes of hunting on bent knees. Almost every room I have stayed in required the attention of housekeeping to make the electric outlet in the bathroom charge my razor. Want to play a DVD and wind down? Better call housekeeping for a player; unlike many top hotels, there isn't one in your room when you arrive. Nor will you find the complimentary broadband that, if nothing else, saves clicking through four annoying windows every 24 hours in order to re-activate the service. And the service itself is slower than what I enjoy at home despite the elevated daily cost. Perhaps my greatest opprobrium, however, is saved for the health club's paucity of treadmills. When your hotel is on the Equator, it should be a given that a number of your (aspiring) health-concious guests may not want to brave 25+ degrees Celcius with attendant humidity to get in a jog before work. Waiting in line to get exercise should be a thing of the past. If you want to get good value for money in the general vicinity, try the Pan-Pacific Hotel. If you want an elevated level of service and comfort, then the Ritz Carlton might well be your destination. I spend so much time at the Fullerton because it is a sub-10 minute walk to my office in a city where taxis vanish faster than anything David Copperfield could manage when the rain starts. Because, after all, it's location, location, location...

Reviews.Title: “Colonial Charm & Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: dojc
Reviews.Content: Be prepared for a treat!!! My girl friend and I stayed three nights at the Fullerton and found it a great place. It was reasonably priced (and we managed to get Buffet Breakfast included) at $260 AUD per night - for weekend nights and $380 per night for weekday nights. We stayed in a courtyard room and it was a good size. Well set up for business travellers (altho' I had dumped the lap top for our short break). The rooms have the tallest beds I have ever seen! Magnificent bathroom, huge shower, separate toilet and double bath. The food was excellent, and just a 5 min walk away are many great eateries, great historic sites (Raffles Landing). Taxi's were in abundance at the front door. And you can get a water taxi for a few dollars just at the back of the hotel. The staff were always smiling and only too willing to help. The hotel facilities are excellent and its worth spending time and exploring the hotel. Some beautiful Chinese antiques can be seen. Oh the pool is excellent, great to destress in. The Fullerton used to be the site of the post office and the upper floors were business offices. $400Million Singapore dollars have been spent on renovations (The outside of the building is 'heritage listed' and cannot be altered - thank goodness) and each room is a different in layout. I cant wait to go back!!!! Hints; The concierge area have visitors maps available and will help with directions. You can get late checkout until 2pm. Normal checkout is 12. Luggage can be left with the concierge in a locked area. The in house laundry facilities are pricy but prompt. If you fly Singapore Airlines keep your boarding card stub and you can get cheap all day bus travel. Be ready to be baffled by the taxi charging system! Be careful when getting a taxi - the mercedes charge limo prices. Go to the Esplanade (a few minutes walk) Oh just go and be pampered!!! Its great!!

Reviews.Title: “Fullerton Hotel- A Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: JKM808
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a business/holiday trip to Singapore where we stayed in the Fullerton for seven nights--overall, it was an excellent experience! The facilities and the service are top-notch. The Fullerton was Singapore's general post office and like the city's other government buildings, the Fullerton is a classically designed and beautiful building. The hotel is located in the colonial/financial district of Singapore making for a nice mix of modernity and leisure. Its also nice to be away (but not too far away) from the hustle-n-bustle of the main tourist attractions like Orchard Road and other shopping areas. We stayed on the seventh floor for the first six nights of our stay. The room size is average (think Hyatt or Hilton-sized) but the bathroom is definitely on the larger size with both a large shower and soaking tub. Though the room wasn't huge, the balcony view of the Singapore river made up for it. (The seventh floor is the only floor with these views.) The pool wasn't huge but was extremely well maintained and a nice escape from the busy street just two floors down. It overlooked the Singapore River and the city's buildings beautifully. The hotel's service was top-notch and extremely responsive. We also ordered room service and dined in the lobby restaurant--both were good but not fantastic compared to the many excellent restaurants we dined in only a stone's throw away from the hotel itself. (We highly recommend Indochine which neighbors the Asian Civilizations Museum.) We'd stay in the Fullerton Hotel again in a heartbeat. The excellent location, great facilities, and responsive service made for a great experience.
